1934  ++j; /*include the first zero*/
1935  if (j <= 10) /*repeat code 17 supports max 10 zeroes*/ {
1936  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 17;
1937  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = j - 3;
1938  }
1939  else /*repeat code 18 supports max 138 zeroes*/ {
1940  if (j > 138) j = 138;
1941  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 18;
1942  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = j - 11;
1943  }
1944  i += (j - 1);
1945  }
1946  else if (j >= 3) /*repeat code for value other than zero*/ {
1947  size_t k;
1948  unsigned num = j / 6u, rest = j % 6u;
1949  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = bitlen_lld[i];
1950  for (k = 0; k < num; ++k) {
1951  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 16;
1952  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 6 - 3;
1953  }
1954  if (rest >= 3) {
1955  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 16;
1956  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = rest - 3;
1957  }
1958  else j -= rest;
1959  i += j;
1960  }
1961  else /*too short to benefit from repeat code*/ {
1962  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = bitlen_lld[i];
1963  }
1964  }
1965 
1966  /*generate tree_cl, the huffmantree of huffmantrees*/
1967  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_lld_e; ++i) {
1968  ++frequencies_cl[bitlen_lld_e[i]];
1969  /*after a repeat code come the bits that specify the number of repetitions,
1970  those don't need to be in the frequencies_cl calculation*/
1971  if (bitlen_lld_e[i] >= 16) ++i;
1972  }
1973 
1974  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(&tree_cl, frequencies_cl,
1975  NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES, NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES, 7);
1976  if (error) break;
1977 
1978  /*compute amount of code-length-code-lengths to output*/
1979  numcodes_cl = NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES;
1980  /*trim zeros at the end (using CLCL_ORDER), but minimum size must be 4 (see HCLEN below)*/
1981  while (numcodes_cl > 4u && tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[numcodes_cl - 1u]] == 0) {
1982  numcodes_cl--;
1983  }
1984 
1985  /*
1986  Write everything into the output
1987 
1988  After the BFINAL and BTYPE, the dynamic block consists out of the following:
1989  - 5 bits HLIT, 5 bits HDIST, 4 bits HCLEN
1990  - (HCLEN+4)*3 bits code lengths of code length alphabet
1991  - HLIT + 257 code lengths of lit/length alphabet (encoded using the code length
1992  alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1993  - HDIST + 1 code lengths of distance alphabet (encoded using the code length
1994  alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1995  - compressed data
1996  - 256 (end code)
1997  */
1998 
1999  /*Write block type*/
2000  writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
2001  writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
2002  writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
2003 
2004  /*write the HLIT, HDIST and HCLEN values*/
2005  /*all three sizes take trimmed ending zeroes into account, done either by HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies
2006  or in the loop for numcodes_cl above, which saves space. */
2007  HLIT = (unsigned)(numcodes_ll - 257);
2008  HDIST = (unsigned)(numcodes_d - 1);
2009  HCLEN = (unsigned)(numcodes_cl - 4);
2010  writeBits(writer, HLIT, 5);
2011  writeBits(writer, HDIST, 5);
2012  writeBits(writer, HCLEN, 4);
2013 
2014  /*write the code lengths of the code length alphabet ("bitlen_cl")*/
2015  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_cl; ++i) writeBits(writer, tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[i]], 3);
2016 
2017  /*write the lengths of the lit/len AND the dist alphabet*/
2018  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_lld_e; ++i) {
2019  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_cl.codes[bitlen_lld_e[i]], tree_cl.lengths[bitlen_lld_e[i]]);
2020  /*extra bits of repeat codes*/
2021  if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 16) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 2);
2022  else if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 17) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 3);
2023  else if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 18) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 7);
2024  }
2025 
2026  /*write the compressed data symbols*/
2027  writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2028  /*error: the length of the end code 256 must be larger than 0*/
2029  if (tree_ll.lengths[256] == 0) ERROR_BREAK(64);
2030 
2031  /*write the end code*/
2032  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[256], tree_ll.lengths[256]);
2033 
2034  break; /*end of error-while*/
2035  }
2036 
2037  /*cleanup*/
2038  uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2039  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2040  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2041  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_cl);
2042  lodepng_free(frequencies_ll);
2043  lodepng_free(frequencies_d);
2044  lodepng_free(frequencies_cl);
2045  lodepng_free(bitlen_lld);
2046  lodepng_free(bitlen_lld_e);
2047 
2048  return error;
2049 }
2050 
2051 static unsigned deflateFixed(LodePNGBitWriter* writer, Hash* hash,
2052  const unsigned char* data,
2053  size_t datapos, size_t dataend,
2054  const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings, unsigned final) {
2055  HuffmanTree tree_ll; /*tree for literal values and length codes*/
2056  HuffmanTree tree_d; /*tree for distance codes*/
2057 
2058  unsigned BFINAL = final;
2059  unsigned error = 0;
2060  size_t i;
2061 
2062  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_ll);
2063  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_d);
2064 
2065  error = generateFixedLitLenTree(&tree_ll);
2066  if (!error) error = generateFixedDistanceTree(&tree_d);
2067 
2068  if (!error) {
2069  writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
2070  writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE*/
2071  writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE*/
2072 
2073  if (settings->use_lz77) /*LZ77 encoded*/ {
2074  uivector lz77_encoded;
2075  uivector_init(&lz77_encoded);
2076  error = encodeLZ77(&lz77_encoded, hash, data, datapos, dataend, settings->windowsize,
2077  settings->minmatch, settings->nicematch, settings->lazymatching);
2078  if (!error) writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2079  uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2080  }
2081  else /*no LZ77, but still will be Huffman compressed*/ {
2082  for (i = datapos; i < dataend; ++i) {
2083  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[data[i]], tree_ll.lengths[data[i]]);
2084  }
2085  }
2086  /*add END code*/
2087  if (!error) writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[256], tree_ll.lengths[256]);
2088  }
2089 
2090  /*cleanup*/
2091  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2092  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2093 
2094  return error;
2095 }
2096 
2097 static unsigned lodepng_deflatev(ucvector* out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2098  const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2099  unsigned error = 0;
2100  size_t i, blocksize, numdeflateblocks;
2101  Hash hash;
2102  LodePNGBitWriter writer;
2103 
2104  LodePNGBitWriter_init(&writer, out);
2105 
2106  if (settings->btype > 2) return 61;
2107  else if (settings->btype == 0) return deflateNoCompression(out, in, insize);
2108  else if (settings->btype == 1) blocksize = insize;
2109  else /*if(settings->btype == 2)*/ {
2110  /*on PNGs, deflate blocks of 65-262k seem to give most dense encoding*/
2111  blocksize = insize / 8u + 8;
2112  if (blocksize < 65536) blocksize = 65536;
2113  if (blocksize > 262144) blocksize = 262144;
2114  }
2115 
2116  numdeflateblocks = (insize + blocksize - 1) / blocksize;
2117  if (numdeflateblocks == 0) numdeflateblocks = 1;
2118 
2119  error = hash_init(&hash, settings->windowsize);
2120 
2121  if (!error) {
2122  for (i = 0; i != numdeflateblocks && !error; ++i) {
2123  unsigned final = (i == numdeflateblocks - 1);
2124  size_t start = i * blocksize;
2125  size_t end = start + blocksize;
2126  if (end > insize) end = insize;
2127 
2128  if (settings->btype == 1) error = deflateFixed(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2129  else if (settings->btype == 2) error = deflateDynamic(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2130  }
2131  }
2132 
2133  hash_cleanup(&hash);
2134 
2135  return error;
2136 }
2137 
2138 unsigned lodepng_deflate(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2139  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2140  const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2141  ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2142  unsigned error = lodepng_deflatev(&v, in, insize, settings);
2143  *out = v.data;
2144  *outsize = v.size;
2145  return error;
2146 }
2147 
2148 static unsigned deflate(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2149  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2150  const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2151  if (settings->custom_deflate) {
2152  return settings->custom_deflate(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2153  }
2154  else {
2155  return lodepng_deflate(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2156  }
2157 }
2158 
2159 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2160 
2161 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2162 /* / Adler32 / */
2163 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2164 
2165 static unsigned update_adler32(unsigned adler, const unsigned char* data, unsigned len) {
2166  unsigned s1 = adler & 0xffffu;
2167  unsigned s2 = (adler >> 16u) & 0xffffu;
2168 
2169  while (len != 0u) {
2170  unsigned i;
2171  /*at least 5552 sums can be done before the sums overflow, saving a lot of module divisions*/
2172  unsigned amount = len > 5552u ? 5552u : len;
2173  len -= amount;
2174  for (i = 0; i != amount; ++i) {
2175  s1 += (*data++);
2176  s2 += s1;
2177  }
2178  s1 %= 65521u;
2179  s2 %= 65521u;
2180  }
2181 
2182  return (s2 << 16u) | s1;
2183 }
2184 
2185 /*Return the adler32 of the bytes data[0..len-1]*/
2186 static unsigned adler32(const unsigned char* data, unsigned len) {
2187  return update_adler32(1u, data, len);
2188 }
2189 
2190 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2191 /* / Zlib / */
2192 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2193 
2194 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2195 
2196 static unsigned lodepng_zlib_decompressv(ucvector* out,
2197  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
2198  const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2199  unsigned error = 0;
2200  unsigned CM, CINFO, FDICT;
2201 
2202  if (insize < 2) return 53; /*error, size of zlib data too small*/
2203  /*read information from zlib header*/
2204  if ((in[0] * 256 + in[1]) % 31 != 0) {
2205  /*error: 256 * in[0] + in[1] must be a multiple of 31, the FCHECK value is supposed to be made that way*/
2206  return 24;
2207  }
2208 
2209  CM = in[0] & 15;
2210  CINFO = (in[0] >> 4) & 15;
2211  /*FCHECK = in[1] & 31;*/ /*FCHECK is already tested above*/
2212  FDICT = (in[1] >> 5) & 1;
2213  /*FLEVEL = (in[1] >> 6) & 3;*/ /*FLEVEL is not used here*/
2214 
2215  if (CM != 8 || CINFO > 7) {
2216  /*error: only compression method 8: inflate with sliding window of 32k is supported by the PNG spec*/
2217  return 25;
2218  }
2219  if (FDICT != 0) {
2220  /*error: the specification of PNG says about the zlib stream:
2221  "The additional flags shall not specify a preset dictionary."*/
2222  return 26;
2223  }
2224 
2225  error = inflatev(out, in + 2, insize - 2, settings);
2226  if (error) return error;
2227 
2228  if (!settings->ignore_adler32) {
2229  unsigned ADLER32 = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[insize - 4]);
2230  unsigned checksum = adler32(out->data, (unsigned)(out->size));
2231  if (checksum != ADLER32) return 58; /*error, adler checksum not correct, data must be corrupted*/
2232  }
2233 
2234  return 0; /*no error*/
2235 }
2236 
2237 
2238 unsigned lodepng_zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2239  size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2240  ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2241  unsigned error = lodepng_zlib_decompressv(&v, in, insize, settings);
2242  *out = v.data;
2243  *outsize = v.size;
2244  return error;
2245 }
2246 
2247 /*expected_size is expected output size, to avoid intermediate allocations. Set to 0 if not known. */
2248 static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, size_t expected_size,
2249  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2250  if (settings->custom_zlib) {
2251  return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2252  }
2253  else {
2254  unsigned error;
2255  ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2256  if (expected_size) {
2257  /*reserve the memory to avoid intermediate reallocations*/
2258  ucvector_resize(&v, *outsize + expected_size);
2259  v.size = *outsize;
2260  }
2261  error = lodepng_zlib_decompressv(&v, in, insize, settings);
2262  *out = v.data;
2263  *outsize = v.size;
2264  return error;
2265  }
2266 }
2267 
2268 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2269 
2270 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2271 
2272 unsigned lodepng_zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2273  size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2274  size_t i;
2275  unsigned error;
2276  unsigned char* deflatedata = 0;
2277  size_t deflatesize = 0;
2278 
2279  error = deflate(&deflatedata, &deflatesize, in, insize, settings);
2280 
2281  *out = NULL;
2282  *outsize = 0;
2283  if (!error) {
2284  *outsize = deflatesize + 6;
2285  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
2286  if (!*out) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
2287  }
2288 
2289  if (!error) {
2290  unsigned ADLER32 = adler32(in, (unsigned)insize);
2291  /*zlib data: 1 byte CMF (CM+CINFO), 1 byte FLG, deflate data, 4 byte ADLER32 checksum of the Decompressed data*/
2292  unsigned CMF = 120; /*0b01111000: CM 8, CINFO 7. With CINFO 7, any window size up to 32768 can be used.*/
2293  unsigned FLEVEL = 0;
2294  unsigned FDICT = 0;
2295  unsigned CMFFLG = 256 * CMF + FDICT * 32 + FLEVEL * 64;
2296  unsigned FCHECK = 31 - CMFFLG % 31;
2297  CMFFLG += FCHECK;
2298 
2299  (*out)[0] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG >> 8);
2300  (*out)[1] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG & 255);
2301  for (i = 0; i != deflatesize; ++i) (*out)[i + 2] = deflatedata[i];
2302  lodepng_set32bitInt(&(*out)[*outsize - 4], ADLER32);
2303  }
2304 
2305  lodepng_free(deflatedata);
2306  return error;
2307 }
2308 
2309 /* compress using the default or custom zlib function */
2310 static unsigned zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2311  size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2312  if (settings->custom_zlib) {
2313  return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2314  }
2315  else {
2316  return lodepng_zlib_compress(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2317  }
2318 }
2319 
2320 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2321 
2322 #else /*no LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB*/
2323 
2324 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2325 static unsigned zlib_decompress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, size_t expected_size,
2326  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2327  if (!settings->custom_zlib) return 87; /*no custom zlib function provided */
2328  (void)expected_size;
2329  return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2330 }
2331 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2332 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2333 static unsigned zlib_compress(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
2334  size_t insize, const LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2335  if (!settings->custom_zlib) return 87; /*no custom zlib function provided */
2336  return settings->custom_zlib(out, outsize, in, insize, settings);
2337 }
2338 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2339 
2340 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB*/
2341 
2342 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2343 
2344 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
2345 
2346 /*this is a good tradeoff between speed and compression ratio*/
2347 #define DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE 2048
2348 
2349 void lodepng_compress_settings_init(LodePNGCompressSettings* settings) {
2350  /*compress with dynamic huffman tree (not in the mathematical sense, just not the predefined one)*/
2351  settings->btype = 2;
2352  settings->use_lz77 = 1;
2353  settings->windowsize = DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE;
2354  settings->minmatch = 3;
2355  settings->nicematch = 128;
2356  settings->lazymatching = 1;
2357 
2358  settings->custom_zlib = 0;
2359  settings->custom_deflate = 0;
2360  settings->custom_context = 0;
2361 }
2362 
2363 const LodePNGCompressSettings lodepng_default_compress_settings = { 2, 1, DEFAULT_WINDOWSIZE, 3, 128, 1, 0, 0, 0 };
2364 
2365 
2366 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
2367 
2368 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2369 
2370 void lodepng_decompress_settings_init(LodePNGDecompressSettings* settings) {
2371  settings->ignore_adler32 = 0;
2372  settings->ignore_nlen = 0;
2373 
2374  settings->custom_zlib = 0;
2375  settings->custom_inflate = 0;
2376  settings->custom_context = 0;
2377 }
2378 
2379 const LodePNGDecompressSettings lodepng_default_decompress_settings = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
2380 
2381 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2382 
2383 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2384 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2385 /* // End of Zlib related code. Begin of PNG related code. // */
2386 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2387 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2388 
2389 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
2390 
2391 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2392 /* / CRC32 / */
2393 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2394 
2395 
2396 #ifndef LODEPNG_NO_COMPILE_CRC
2397 /* CRC polynomial: 0xedb88320 */
2398 static unsigned lodepng_crc32_table[256] = {
2399  0u, 1996959894u, 3993919788u, 2567524794u, 124634137u, 1886057615u, 3915621685u, 2657392035u,
2400  249268274u, 2044508324u, 3772115230u, 2547177864u, 162941995u, 2125561021u, 3887607047u, 2428444049u,
2401  498536548u, 1789927666u, 4089016648u, 2227061214u, 450548861u, 1843258603u, 4107580753u, 2211677639u,
2402  325883990u, 1684777152u, 4251122042u, 2321926636u, 335633487u, 1661365465u, 4195302755u, 2366115317u,
2403  997073096u, 1281953886u, 3579855332u, 2724688242u, 1006888145u, 1258607687u, 3524101629u, 2768942443u,
2404  901097722u, 1119000684u, 3686517206u, 2898065728u, 853044451u, 1172266101u, 3705015759u, 2882616665u,
2405  651767980u, 1373503546u, 3369554304u, 3218104598u, 565507253u, 1454621731u, 3485111705u, 3099436303u,
2406  671266974u, 1594198024u, 3322730930u, 2970347812u, 795835527u, 1483230225u, 3244367275u, 3060149565u,
2407  1994146192u, 31158534u, 2563907772u, 4023717930u, 1907459465u, 112637215u, 2680153253u, 3904427059u,
2408  2013776290u, 251722036u, 2517215374u, 3775830040u, 2137656763u, 141376813u, 2439277719u, 3865271297u,
2409  1802195444u, 476864866u, 2238001368u, 4066508878u, 1812370925u, 453092731u, 2181625025u, 4111451223u,
2410  1706088902u, 314042704u, 2344532202u, 4240017532u, 1658658271u, 366619977u, 2362670323u, 4224994405u,
2411  1303535960u, 984961486u, 2747007092u, 3569037538u, 1256170817u, 1037604311u, 2765210733u, 3554079995u,
2412  1131014506u, 879679996u, 2909243462u, 3663771856u, 1141124467u, 855842277u, 2852801631u, 3708648649u,
2413  1342533948u, 654459306u, 3188396048u, 3373015174u, 1466479909u, 544179635u, 3110523913u, 3462522015u,
2414  1591671054u, 702138776u, 2966460450u, 3352799412u, 1504918807u, 783551873u, 3082640443u, 3233442989u,
2415  3988292384u, 2596254646u, 62317068u, 1957810842u, 3939845945u, 2647816111u, 81470997u, 1943803523u,
2416  3814918930u, 2489596804u, 225274430u, 2053790376u, 3826175755u, 2466906013u, 167816743u, 2097651377u,
2417  4027552580u, 2265490386u, 503444072u, 1762050814u, 4150417245u, 2154129355u, 426522225u, 1852507879u,
2418  4275313526u, 2312317920u, 282753626u, 1742555852u, 4189708143u, 2394877945u, 397917763u, 1622183637u,
2419  3604390888u, 2714866558u, 953729732u, 1340076626u, 3518719985u, 2797360999u, 1068828381u, 1219638859u,
2420  3624741850u, 2936675148u, 906185462u, 1090812512u, 3747672003u, 2825379669u, 829329135u, 1181335161u,
2421  3412177804u, 3160834842u, 628085408u, 1382605366u, 3423369109u, 3138078467u, 570562233u, 1426400815u,
2422  3317316542u, 2998733608u, 733239954u, 1555261956u, 3268935591u, 3050360625u, 752459403u, 1541320221u,
2423  2607071920u, 3965973030u, 1969922972u, 40735498u, 2617837225u, 3943577151u, 1913087877u, 83908371u,
2424  2512341634u, 3803740692u, 2075208622u, 213261112u, 2463272603u, 3855990285u, 2094854071u, 198958881u,
2425  2262029012u, 4057260610u, 1759359992u, 534414190u, 2176718541u, 4139329115u, 1873836001u, 414664567u,
2426  2282248934u, 4279200368u, 1711684554u, 285281116u, 2405801727u, 4167216745u, 1634467795u, 376229701u,
2427  2685067896u, 3608007406u, 1308918612u, 956543938u, 2808555105u, 3495958263u, 1231636301u, 1047427035u,
2428  2932959818u, 3654703836u, 1088359270u, 936918000u, 2847714899u, 3736837829u, 1202900863u, 817233897u,
2429  3183342108u, 3401237130u, 1404277552u, 615818150u, 3134207493u, 3453421203u, 1423857449u, 601450431u,
2430  3009837614u, 3294710456u, 1567103746u, 711928724u, 3020668471u, 3272380065u, 1510334235u, 755167117u
2431 };
2432 
2433 /*Return the CRC of the bytes buf[0..len-1].*/
2434 unsigned lodepng_crc32(const unsigned char* data, size_t length) {
2435  unsigned r = 0xffffffffu;
2436  size_t i;
2437  for (i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
2438  r = lodepng_crc32_table[(r ^ data[i]) & 0xffu] ^ (r >> 8u);
2439  }
2440  return r ^ 0xffffffffu;
2441 }
2442 #else /* !LODEPNG_NO_COMPILE_CRC */
2443 unsigned lodepng_crc32(const unsigned char* data, size_t length);
2444 #endif /* !LODEPNG_NO_COMPILE_CRC */
2445 
2446 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2447 /* / Reading and writing PNG color channel bits / */
2448 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2449 
2450 /* The color channel bits of less-than-8-bit pixels are read with the MSB of bytes first,
2451 so LodePNGBitWriter and LodePNGBitReader can't be used for those. */
2452 
2453 static unsigned char readBitFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream) {
2454  unsigned char result = (unsigned char)((bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3] >> (7 - ((*bitpointer) & 0x7))) & 1);
2455  ++(*bitpointer);
2456  return result;
2457 }
2458 
2459 /* TODO: make this faster */
2460 static unsigned readBitsFromReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, const unsigned char* bitstream, size_t nbits) {
2461  unsigned result = 0;
2462  size_t i;
2463  for (i = 0; i < nbits; ++i) {
2464  result <<= 1u;
2465  result |= (unsigned)readBitFromReversedStream(bitpointer, bitstream);
2466  }
2467  return result;
2468 }
2469 
2470 static void setBitOfReversedStream(size_t* bitpointer, unsigned char* bitstream, unsigned char bit) {
2471  /*the current bit in bitstream may be 0 or 1 for this to work*/
2472  if (bit == 0) bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3u] &= (unsigned char)(~(1u << (7u - ((*bitpointer) & 7u))));
2473  else bitstream[(*bitpointer) >> 3u] |= (1u << (7u - ((*bitpointer) & 7u)));
2474  ++(*bitpointer);
2475 }
2476 
2477 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2478 /* / PNG chunks / */
2479 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2480 
2481 unsigned lodepng_chunk_length(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2482  return lodepng_read32bitInt(&chunk[0]);
2483 }
2484 
2485 void lodepng_chunk_type(char type[5], const unsigned char* chunk) {
2486  unsigned i;
2487  for (i = 0; i != 4; ++i) type[i] = (char)chunk[4 + i];
2488  type[4] = 0; /*null termination char*/
2489 }
2490 
2491 unsigned char lodepng_chunk_type_equals(const unsigned char* chunk, const char* type) {
2492  if (lodepng_strlen(type) != 4) return 0;
2493  return (chunk[4] == type[0] && chunk[5] == type[1] && chunk[6] == type[2] && chunk[7] == type[3]);
2494 }
2495 
2496 unsigned char lodepng_chunk_ancillary(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2497  return((chunk[4] & 32) != 0);
2498 }
2499 
2500 unsigned char lodepng_chunk_private(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2501  return((chunk[6] & 32) != 0);
2502 }
2503 
2504 unsigned char lodepng_chunk_safetocopy(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2505  return((chunk[7] & 32) != 0);
2506 }
2507 
2508 unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_data(unsigned char* chunk) {
2509  return &chunk[8];
2510 }
2511 
2512 const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_data_const(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2513  return &chunk[8];
2514 }
2515 
2516 unsigned lodepng_chunk_check_crc(const unsigned char* chunk) {
2517  unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2518  unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&chunk[length + 8]);
2519  /*the CRC is taken of the data and the 4 chunk type letters, not the length*/
2520  unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2521  if (CRC != checksum) return 1;
2522  else return 0;
2523 }
2524 
2525 void lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(unsigned char* chunk) {
2526  unsigned length = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
2527  unsigned CRC = lodepng_crc32(&chunk[4], length + 4);
2528  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8 + length, CRC);
2529 }
2530 
2531 unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_next(unsigned char* chunk, unsigned char* end) {
2532  if (chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return end; /*too small to contain a chunk*/
2533  if (chunk[0] == 0x89 && chunk[1] == 0x50 && chunk[2] == 0x4e && chunk[3] == 0x47
2534  && chunk[4] == 0x0d && chunk[5] == 0x0a && chunk[6] == 0x1a && chunk[7] == 0x0a) {
2535  /* Is PNG magic header at start of PNG file. Jump to first actual chunk. */
2536  return chunk + 8;
2537  }
2538  else {
2539  size_t total_chunk_length;
2540  unsigned char* result;
2541  if (lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return end;
2542  result = chunk + total_chunk_length;
2543  if (result < chunk) return end; /*pointer overflow*/
2544  return result;
2545  }
2546 }
2547 
2548 const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_next_const(const unsigned char* chunk, const unsigned char* end) {
2549  if (chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return end; /*too small to contain a chunk*/
2550  if (chunk[0] == 0x89 && chunk[1] == 0x50 && chunk[2] == 0x4e && chunk[3] == 0x47
2551  && chunk[4] == 0x0d && chunk[5] == 0x0a && chunk[6] == 0x1a && chunk[7] == 0x0a) {
2552  /* Is PNG magic header at start of PNG file. Jump to first actual chunk. */
2553  return chunk + 8;
2554  }
2555  else {
2556  size_t total_chunk_length;
2557  const unsigned char* result;
2558  if (lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return end;
2559  result = chunk + total_chunk_length;
2560  if (result < chunk) return end; /*pointer overflow*/
2561  return result;
2562  }
2563 }
2564 
2565 unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_find(unsigned char* chunk, unsigned char* end, const char type[5]) {
2566  for (;;) {
2567  if (chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return 0; /* past file end: chunk + 12 > end */
2568  if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, type)) return chunk;
2569  chunk = lodepng_chunk_next(chunk, end);
2570  }
2571 }
2572 
2573 const unsigned char* lodepng_chunk_find_const(const unsigned char* chunk, const unsigned char* end, const char type[5]) {
2574  for (;;) {
2575  if (chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return 0; /* past file end: chunk + 12 > end */
2576  if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, type)) return chunk;
2577  chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk, end);
2578  }
2579 }
2580 
2581 unsigned lodepng_chunk_append(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* chunk) {
2582  unsigned i;
2583  size_t total_chunk_length, new_length;
2584  unsigned char* chunk_start, * new_buffer;
2585 
2586  if (lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return 77;
2587  if (lodepng_addofl(*outsize, total_chunk_length, &new_length)) return 77;
2588 
2589  new_buffer = (unsigned char*)lodepng_realloc(*out, new_length);
2590  if (!new_buffer) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2591  (*out) = new_buffer;
2592  (*outsize) = new_length;
2593  chunk_start = &(*out)[new_length - total_chunk_length];
2594 
2595  for (i = 0; i != total_chunk_length; ++i) chunk_start[i] = chunk[i];
2596 
2597  return 0;
2598 }
2599 
2600 /*Sets length and name and allocates the space for data and crc but does not
2601 set data or crc yet. Returns the start of the chunk in chunk. The start of
2602 the data is at chunk + 8. To finalize chunk, add the data, then use
2603 lodepng_chunk_generate_crc */
2604 static unsigned lodepng_chunk_init(unsigned char** chunk,
2605  ucvector* out,
2606  unsigned length, const char* type) {
2607  size_t new_length = out->size;
2608  if (lodepng_addofl(new_length, length, &new_length)) return 77;
2609  if (lodepng_addofl(new_length, 12, &new_length)) return 77;
2610  if (!ucvector_resize(out, new_length)) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2611  *chunk = out->data + new_length - length - 12u;
2612 
2613  /*1: length*/
2614  lodepng_set32bitInt(*chunk, length);
2615 
2616  /*2: chunk name (4 letters)*/
2617  lodepng_memcpy(*chunk + 4, type, 4);
2618 
2619  return 0;
2620 }
2621 
2622 /* like lodepng_chunk_create but with custom allocsize */
2623 static unsigned lodepng_chunk_createv(ucvector* out,
2624  unsigned length, const char* type, const unsigned char* data) {
2625  unsigned char* chunk;
2626  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, length, type));
2627 
2628  /*3: the data*/
2629  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, data, length);
2630 
2631  /*4: CRC (of the chunkname characters and the data)*/
2632  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
2633 
2634  return 0;
2635 }
2636 
2637 unsigned lodepng_chunk_create(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
2638  unsigned length, const char* type, const unsigned char* data) {
2639  ucvector v = ucvector_init(*out, *outsize);
2640  unsigned error = lodepng_chunk_createv(&v, length, type, data);
2641  *out = v.data;
2642  *outsize = v.size;
2643  return error;
2644 }
2645 
2646 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2647 /* / Color types, channels, bits / */
2648 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2649 
2650 /*checks if the colortype is valid and the bitdepth bd is allowed for this colortype.
2651 Return value is a LodePNG error code.*/
2652 static unsigned checkColorValidity(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bd) {
2653  switch (colortype) {
2654  case LCT_GREY: if (!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2655  case LCT_RGB: if (!(bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2656  case LCT_PALETTE: if (!(bd == 1 || bd == 2 || bd == 4 || bd == 8)) return 37; break;
2657  case LCT_GREY_ALPHA: if (!(bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2658  case LCT_RGBA: if (!(bd == 8 || bd == 16)) return 37; break;
2659  case LCT_MAX_OCTET_VALUE: return 31; /* invalid color type */
2660  default: return 31; /* invalid color type */
2661  }
2662  return 0; /*allowed color type / bits combination*/
2663 }
2664 
2665 static unsigned getNumColorChannels(LodePNGColorType colortype) {
2666  switch (colortype) {
2667  case LCT_GREY: return 1;
2668  case LCT_RGB: return 3;
2669  case LCT_PALETTE: return 1;
2670  case LCT_GREY_ALPHA: return 2;
2671  case LCT_RGBA: return 4;
2672  case LCT_MAX_OCTET_VALUE: return 0; /* invalid color type */
2673  default: return 0; /*invalid color type*/
2674  }
2675 }
2676 
2677 static unsigned lodepng_get_bpp_lct(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2678  /*bits per pixel is amount of channels * bits per channel*/
2679  return getNumColorChannels(colortype) * bitdepth;
2680 }
2681 
2682 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
2683 
2684 void lodepng_color_mode_init(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2685  info->key_defined = 0;
2686  info->key_r = info->key_g = info->key_b = 0;
2687  info->colortype = LCT_RGBA;
2688  info->bitdepth = 8;
2689  info->palette = 0;
2690  info->palettesize = 0;
2691 }
2692 
2693 /*allocates palette memory if needed, and initializes all colors to black*/
2694 static void lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2695  size_t i;
2696  /*if the palette is already allocated, it will have size 1024 so no reallocation needed in that case*/
2697  /*the palette must have room for up to 256 colors with 4 bytes each.*/
2698  if (!info->palette) info->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(1024);
2699  if (!info->palette) return; /*alloc fail*/
2700  for (i = 0; i != 256; ++i) {
2701  /*Initialize all unused colors with black, the value used for invalid palette indices.
2702  This is an error according to the PNG spec, but common PNG decoders make it black instead.
2703  That makes color conversion slightly faster due to no error handling needed.*/
2704  info->palette[i * 4 + 0] = 0;
2705  info->palette[i * 4 + 1] = 0;
2706  info->palette[i * 4 + 2] = 0;
2707  info->palette[i * 4 + 3] = 255;
2708  }
2709 }
2710 
2711 void lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2712  lodepng_palette_clear(info);
2713 }
2714 
2715 unsigned lodepng_color_mode_copy(LodePNGColorMode* dest, const LodePNGColorMode* source) {
2716  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(dest);
2717  lodepng_memcpy(dest, source, sizeof(LodePNGColorMode));
2718  if (source->palette) {
2719  dest->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(1024);
2720  if (!dest->palette && source->palettesize) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2721  lodepng_memcpy(dest->palette, source->palette, source->palettesize * 4);
2722  }
2723  return 0;
2724 }
2725 
2726 LodePNGColorMode lodepng_color_mode_make(LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2727  LodePNGColorMode result;
2728  lodepng_color_mode_init(&result);
2729  result.colortype = colortype;
2730  result.bitdepth = bitdepth;
2731  return result;
2732 }
2733 
2734 static int lodepng_color_mode_equal(const LodePNGColorMode* a, const LodePNGColorMode* b) {
2735  size_t i;
2736  if (a->colortype != b->colortype) return 0;
2737  if (a->bitdepth != b->bitdepth) return 0;
2738  if (a->key_defined != b->key_defined) return 0;
2739  if (a->key_defined) {
2740  if (a->key_r != b->key_r) return 0;
2741  if (a->key_g != b->key_g) return 0;
2742  if (a->key_b != b->key_b) return 0;
2743  }
2744  if (a->palettesize != b->palettesize) return 0;
2745  for (i = 0; i != a->palettesize * 4; ++i) {
2746  if (a->palette[i] != b->palette[i]) return 0;
2747  }
2748  return 1;
2749 }
2750 
2751 void lodepng_palette_clear(LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2752  if (info->palette) lodepng_free(info->palette);
2753  info->palette = 0;
2754  info->palettesize = 0;
2755 }
2756 
2757 unsigned lodepng_palette_add(LodePNGColorMode* info,
2758  unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
2759  if (!info->palette) /*allocate palette if empty*/ {
2760  lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(info);
2761  if (!info->palette) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2762  }
2763  if (info->palettesize >= 256) {
2764  return 108; /*too many palette values*/
2765  }
2766  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 0] = r;
2767  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 1] = g;
2768  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 2] = b;
2769  info->palette[4 * info->palettesize + 3] = a;
2770  ++info->palettesize;
2771  return 0;
2772 }
2773 
2774 /*calculate bits per pixel out of colortype and bitdepth*/
2775 unsigned lodepng_get_bpp(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2776  return lodepng_get_bpp_lct(info->colortype, info->bitdepth);
2777 }
2778 
2779 unsigned lodepng_get_channels(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2780  return getNumColorChannels(info->colortype);
2781 }
2782 
2783 unsigned lodepng_is_greyscale_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2784  return info->colortype == LCT_GREY || info->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA;
2785 }
2786 
2787 unsigned lodepng_is_alpha_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2788  return (info->colortype & 4) != 0; /*4 or 6*/
2789 }
2790 
2791 unsigned lodepng_is_palette_type(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2792  return info->colortype == LCT_PALETTE;
2793 }
2794 
2795 unsigned lodepng_has_palette_alpha(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2796  size_t i;
2797  for (i = 0; i != info->palettesize; ++i) {
2798  if (info->palette[i * 4 + 3] < 255) return 1;
2799  }
2800  return 0;
2801 }
2802 
2803 unsigned lodepng_can_have_alpha(const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
2804  return info->key_defined
2805  || lodepng_is_alpha_type(info)
2806  || lodepng_has_palette_alpha(info);
2807 }
2808 
2809 static size_t lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(unsigned w, unsigned h, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
2810  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp_lct(colortype, bitdepth);
2811  size_t n = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
2812  return ((n / 8u) * bpp) + ((n & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
2813 }
2814 
2815 size_t lodepng_get_raw_size(unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGColorMode* color) {
2816  return lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, color->colortype, color->bitdepth);
2817 }
2818 
2819 
2820 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
2821 
2822 /*in an idat chunk, each scanline is a multiple of 8 bits, unlike the lodepng output buffer,
2823 and in addition has one extra byte per line: the filter byte. So this gives a larger
2824 result than lodepng_get_raw_size. Set h to 1 to get the size of 1 row including filter byte. */
2825 static size_t lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
2826  /* + 1 for the filter byte, and possibly plus padding bits per line. */
2827  /* Ignoring casts, the expression is equal to (w * bpp + 7) / 8 + 1, but avoids overflow of w * bpp */
2828  size_t line = ((size_t)(w / 8u) * bpp) + 1u + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
2829  return (size_t)h * line;
2830 }
2831 
2832 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
2833 /*Safely checks whether size_t overflow can be caused due to amount of pixels.
2834 This check is overcautious rather than precise. If this check indicates no overflow,
2835 you can safely compute in a size_t (but not an unsigned):
2836 -(size_t)w * (size_t)h * 8
2837 -amount of bytes in IDAT (including filter, padding and Adam7 bytes)
2838 -amount of bytes in raw color model
2839 Returns 1 if overflow possible, 0 if not.
2840 */
2841 static int lodepng_pixel_overflow(unsigned w, unsigned h,
2842  const LodePNGColorMode* pngcolor, const LodePNGColorMode* rawcolor) {
2843  size_t bpp = LODEPNG_MAX(lodepng_get_bpp(pngcolor), lodepng_get_bpp(rawcolor));
2844  size_t numpixels, total;
2845  size_t line; /* bytes per line in worst case */
2846 
2847  if (lodepng_mulofl((size_t)w, (size_t)h, &numpixels)) return 1;
2848  if (lodepng_mulofl(numpixels, 8, &total)) return 1; /* bit pointer with 8-bit color, or 8 bytes per channel color */
2849 
2850  /* Bytes per scanline with the expression "(w / 8u) * bpp) + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u" */
2851  if (lodepng_mulofl((size_t)(w / 8u), bpp, &line)) return 1;
2852  if (lodepng_addofl(line, ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u, &line)) return 1;
2853 
2854  if (lodepng_addofl(line, 5, &line)) return 1; /* 5 bytes overhead per line: 1 filterbyte, 4 for Adam7 worst case */
2855  if (lodepng_mulofl(line, h, &total)) return 1; /* Total bytes in worst case */
2856 
2857  return 0; /* no overflow */
2858 }
2859 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
2860 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG*/
2861 
2862 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
2863 
2864 static void LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2865  unsigned i;
2866  for (i = 0; i != 3; ++i) info->unknown_chunks_data[i] = 0;
2867  for (i = 0; i != 3; ++i) info->unknown_chunks_size[i] = 0;
2868 }
2869 
2870 static void LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2871  unsigned i;
2872  for (i = 0; i != 3; ++i) lodepng_free(info->unknown_chunks_data[i]);
2873 }
2874 
2875 static unsigned LodePNGUnknownChunks_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* src) {
2876  unsigned i;
2877 
2878  LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(dest);
2879 
2880  for (i = 0; i != 3; ++i) {
2881  size_t j;
2882  dest->unknown_chunks_size[i] = src->unknown_chunks_size[i];
2883  dest->unknown_chunks_data[i] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(src->unknown_chunks_size[i]);
2884  if (!dest->unknown_chunks_data[i] && dest->unknown_chunks_size[i]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2885  for (j = 0; j < src->unknown_chunks_size[i]; ++j) {
2886  dest->unknown_chunks_data[i][j] = src->unknown_chunks_data[i][j];
2887  }
2888  }
2889 
2890  return 0;
2891 }
2892 
2893 /******************************************************************************/
2894 
2895 static void LodePNGText_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2896  info->text_num = 0;
2897  info->text_keys = NULL;
2898  info->text_strings = NULL;
2899 }
2900 
2901 static void LodePNGText_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2902  size_t i;
2903  for (i = 0; i != info->text_num; ++i) {
2904  string_cleanup(&info->text_keys[i]);
2905  string_cleanup(&info->text_strings[i]);
2906  }
2907  lodepng_free(info->text_keys);
2908  lodepng_free(info->text_strings);
2909 }
2910 
2911 static unsigned LodePNGText_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
2912  size_t i = 0;
2913  dest->text_keys = 0;
2914  dest->text_strings = 0;
2915  dest->text_num = 0;
2916  for (i = 0; i != source->text_num; ++i) {
2917  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_add_text(dest, source->text_keys[i], source->text_strings[i]));
2918  }
2919  return 0;
2920 }
2921 
2922 static unsigned lodepng_add_text_sized(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* str, size_t size) {
2923  char** new_keys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->text_keys, sizeof(char*) * (info->text_num + 1)));
2924  char** new_strings = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->text_strings, sizeof(char*) * (info->text_num + 1)));
2925 
2926  if (new_keys) info->text_keys = new_keys;
2927  if (new_strings) info->text_strings = new_strings;
2928 
2929  if (!new_keys || !new_strings) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2930 
2931  ++info->text_num;
2932  info->text_keys[info->text_num - 1] = alloc_string(key);
2933  info->text_strings[info->text_num - 1] = alloc_string_sized(str, size);
2934  if (!info->text_keys[info->text_num - 1] || !info->text_strings[info->text_num - 1]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
2935 
2936  return 0;
2937 }
2938 
2939 unsigned lodepng_add_text(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* str) {
2940  return lodepng_add_text_sized(info, key, str, lodepng_strlen(str));
2941 }
2942 
2943 void lodepng_clear_text(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2944  LodePNGText_cleanup(info);
2945 }
2946 
2947 /******************************************************************************/
2948 
2949 static void LodePNGIText_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2950  info->itext_num = 0;
2951  info->itext_keys = NULL;
2952  info->itext_langtags = NULL;
2953  info->itext_transkeys = NULL;
2954  info->itext_strings = NULL;
2955 }
2956 
2957 static void LodePNGIText_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2958  size_t i;
2959  for (i = 0; i != info->itext_num; ++i) {
2960  string_cleanup(&info->itext_keys[i]);
2961  string_cleanup(&info->itext_langtags[i]);
2962  string_cleanup(&info->itext_transkeys[i]);
2963  string_cleanup(&info->itext_strings[i]);
2964  }
2965  lodepng_free(info->itext_keys);
2966  lodepng_free(info->itext_langtags);
2967  lodepng_free(info->itext_transkeys);
2968  lodepng_free(info->itext_strings);
2969 }
2970 
2971 static unsigned LodePNGIText_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
2972  size_t i = 0;
2973  dest->itext_keys = 0;
2974  dest->itext_langtags = 0;
2975  dest->itext_transkeys = 0;
2976  dest->itext_strings = 0;
2977  dest->itext_num = 0;
2978  for (i = 0; i != source->itext_num; ++i) {
2979  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_add_itext(dest, source->itext_keys[i], source->itext_langtags[i],
2980  source->itext_transkeys[i], source->itext_strings[i]));
2981  }
2982  return 0;
2983 }
2984 
2985 void lodepng_clear_itext(LodePNGInfo* info) {
2986  LodePNGIText_cleanup(info);
2987 }
2988 
2989 static unsigned lodepng_add_itext_sized(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* langtag,
2990  const char* transkey, const char* str, size_t size) {
2991  char** new_keys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_keys, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2992  char** new_langtags = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_langtags, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2993  char** new_transkeys = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_transkeys, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2994  char** new_strings = (char**)(lodepng_realloc(info->itext_strings, sizeof(char*) * (info->itext_num + 1)));
2995 
2996  if (new_keys) info->itext_keys = new_keys;
2997  if (new_langtags) info->itext_langtags = new_langtags;
2998  if (new_transkeys) info->itext_transkeys = new_transkeys;
2999  if (new_strings) info->itext_strings = new_strings;
3000 
3001  if (!new_keys || !new_langtags || !new_transkeys || !new_strings) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
3002 
3003  ++info->itext_num;
3004 
3005  info->itext_keys[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(key);
3006  info->itext_langtags[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(langtag);
3007  info->itext_transkeys[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string(transkey);
3008  info->itext_strings[info->itext_num - 1] = alloc_string_sized(str, size);
3009 
3010  return 0;
3011 }
3012 
3013 unsigned lodepng_add_itext(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* key, const char* langtag,
3014  const char* transkey, const char* str) {
3015  return lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, str, lodepng_strlen(str));
3016 }
3017 
3018 /* same as set but does not delete */
3019 static unsigned lodepng_assign_icc(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* name, const unsigned char* profile, unsigned profile_size) {
3020  if (profile_size == 0) return 100; /*invalid ICC profile size*/
3021 
3022  info->iccp_name = alloc_string(name);
3023  info->iccp_profile = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(profile_size);
3024 
3025  if (!info->iccp_name || !info->iccp_profile) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
3026 
3027  lodepng_memcpy(info->iccp_profile, profile, profile_size);
3028  info->iccp_profile_size = profile_size;
3029 
3030  return 0; /*ok*/
3031 }
3032 
3033 unsigned lodepng_set_icc(LodePNGInfo* info, const char* name, const unsigned char* profile, unsigned profile_size) {
3034  if (info->iccp_name) lodepng_clear_icc(info);
3035  info->iccp_defined = 1;
3036 
3037  return lodepng_assign_icc(info, name, profile, profile_size);
3038 }
3039 
3040 void lodepng_clear_icc(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3041  string_cleanup(&info->iccp_name);
3042  lodepng_free(info->iccp_profile);
3043  info->iccp_profile = NULL;
3044  info->iccp_profile_size = 0;
3045  info->iccp_defined = 0;
3046 }
3047 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3048 
3049 void lodepng_info_init(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3050  lodepng_color_mode_init(&info->color);
3051  info->interlace_method = 0;
3052  info->compression_method = 0;
3053  info->filter_method = 0;
3054 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3055  info->background_defined = 0;
3056  info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = 0;
3057 
3058  LodePNGText_init(info);
3059  LodePNGIText_init(info);
3060 
3061  info->time_defined = 0;
3062  info->phys_defined = 0;
3063 
3064  info->gama_defined = 0;
3065  info->chrm_defined = 0;
3066  info->srgb_defined = 0;
3067  info->iccp_defined = 0;
3068  info->iccp_name = NULL;
3069  info->iccp_profile = NULL;
3070 
3071  LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(info);
3072 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3073 }
3074 
3075 void lodepng_info_cleanup(LodePNGInfo* info) {
3076  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&info->color);
3077 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3078  LodePNGText_cleanup(info);
3079  LodePNGIText_cleanup(info);
3080 
3081  lodepng_clear_icc(info);
3082 
3083  LodePNGUnknownChunks_cleanup(info);
3084 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3085 }
3086 
3087 unsigned lodepng_info_copy(LodePNGInfo* dest, const LodePNGInfo* source) {
3088  lodepng_info_cleanup(dest);
3089  lodepng_memcpy(dest, source, sizeof(LodePNGInfo));
3090  lodepng_color_mode_init(&dest->color);
3091  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_color_mode_copy(&dest->color, &source->color));
3092 
3093 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3094  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGText_copy(dest, source));
3095  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGIText_copy(dest, source));
3096  if (source->iccp_defined) {
3097  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_assign_icc(dest, source->iccp_name, source->iccp_profile, source->iccp_profile_size));
3098  }
3099 
3100  LodePNGUnknownChunks_init(dest);
3101  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(LodePNGUnknownChunks_copy(dest, source));
3102 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3103  return 0;
3104 }
3105 
3106 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
3107 
3108 /*index: bitgroup index, bits: bitgroup size(1, 2 or 4), in: bitgroup value, out: octet array to add bits to*/
3109 static void addColorBits(unsigned char* out, size_t index, unsigned bits, unsigned in) {
3110  unsigned m = bits == 1 ? 7 : bits == 2 ? 3 : 1; /*8 / bits - 1*/
3111  /*p = the partial index in the byte, e.g. with 4 palettebits it is 0 for first half or 1 for second half*/
3112  unsigned p = index & m;
3113  in &= (1u << bits) - 1u; /*filter out any other bits of the input value*/
3114  in = in << (bits * (m - p));
3115  if (p == 0) out[index * bits / 8u] = in;
3116  else out[index * bits / 8u] |= in;
3117 }
3118 
3119 typedef struct ColorTree ColorTree;
3120 
3121 /*
3122 One node of a color tree
3123 This is the data structure used to count the number of unique colors and to get a palette
3124 index for a color. It's like an octree, but because the alpha channel is used too, each
3125 node has 16 instead of 8 children.
3126 */
3127 struct ColorTree {
3128  ColorTree* children[16]; /*up to 16 pointers to ColorTree of next level*/
3129  int index; /*the payload. Only has a meaningful value if this is in the last level*/
3130 };
3131 
3132 static void color_tree_init(ColorTree* tree) {
3133  lodepng_memset(tree->children, 0, 16 * sizeof(*tree->children));
3134  tree->index = -1;
3135 }
3136 
3137 static void color_tree_cleanup(ColorTree* tree) {
3138  int i;
3139  for (i = 0; i != 16; ++i) {
3140  if (tree->children[i]) {
3141  color_tree_cleanup(tree->children[i]);
3142  lodepng_free(tree->children[i]);
3143  }
3144  }
3145 }
3146 
3147 /*returns -1 if color not present, its index otherwise*/
3148 static int color_tree_get(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3149  int bit = 0;
3150  for (bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
3151  int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3152  if (!tree->children[i]) return -1;
3153  else tree = tree->children[i];
3154  }
3155  return tree ? tree->index : -1;
3156 }
3157 
3158 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
3159 static int color_tree_has(ColorTree* tree, unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3160  return color_tree_get(tree, r, g, b, a) >= 0;
3161 }
3162 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
3163 
3164 /*color is not allowed to already exist.
3165 Index should be >= 0 (it's signed to be compatible with using -1 for "doesn't exist")
3166 Returns error code, or 0 if ok*/
3167 static unsigned color_tree_add(ColorTree* tree,
3168  unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a, unsigned index) {
3169  int bit;
3170  for (bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
3171  int i = 8 * ((r >> bit) & 1) + 4 * ((g >> bit) & 1) + 2 * ((b >> bit) & 1) + 1 * ((a >> bit) & 1);
3172  if (!tree->children[i]) {
3173  tree->children[i] = (ColorTree*)lodepng_malloc(sizeof(ColorTree));
3174  if (!tree->children[i]) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
3175  color_tree_init(tree->children[i]);
3176  }
3177  tree = tree->children[i];
3178  }
3179  tree->index = (int)index;
3180  return 0;
3181 }
3182 
3183 /*put a pixel, given its RGBA color, into image of any color type*/
3184 static unsigned rgba8ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3185  const LodePNGColorMode* mode, ColorTree* tree /*for palette*/,
3186  unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b, unsigned char a) {
3187  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3188  unsigned char gray = r; /*((unsigned short)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3189  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) out[i] = gray;
3190  else if (mode->bitdepth == 16) out[i * 2 + 0] = out[i * 2 + 1] = gray;
3191  else {
3192  /*take the most significant bits of gray*/
3193  gray = ((unsigned)gray >> (8u - mode->bitdepth)) & ((1u << mode->bitdepth) - 1u);
3194  addColorBits(out, i, mode->bitdepth, gray);
3195  }
3196  }
3197  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3198  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3199  out[i * 3 + 0] = r;
3200  out[i * 3 + 1] = g;
3201  out[i * 3 + 2] = b;
3202  }
3203  else {
3204  out[i * 6 + 0] = out[i * 6 + 1] = r;
3205  out[i * 6 + 2] = out[i * 6 + 3] = g;
3206  out[i * 6 + 4] = out[i * 6 + 5] = b;
3207  }
3208  }
3209  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3210  int index = color_tree_get(tree, r, g, b, a);
3211  if (index < 0) return 82; /*color not in palette*/
3212  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) out[i] = index;
3213  else addColorBits(out, i, mode->bitdepth, (unsigned)index);
3214  }
3215  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3216  unsigned char gray = r; /*((unsigned short)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3217  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3218  out[i * 2 + 0] = gray;
3219  out[i * 2 + 1] = a;
3220  }
3221  else if (mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3222  out[i * 4 + 0] = out[i * 4 + 1] = gray;
3223  out[i * 4 + 2] = out[i * 4 + 3] = a;
3224  }
3225  }
3226  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3227  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3228  out[i * 4 + 0] = r;
3229  out[i * 4 + 1] = g;
3230  out[i * 4 + 2] = b;
3231  out[i * 4 + 3] = a;
3232  }
3233  else {
3234  out[i * 8 + 0] = out[i * 8 + 1] = r;
3235  out[i * 8 + 2] = out[i * 8 + 3] = g;
3236  out[i * 8 + 4] = out[i * 8 + 5] = b;
3237  out[i * 8 + 6] = out[i * 8 + 7] = a;
3238  }
3239  }
3240 
3241  return 0; /*no error*/
3242 }
3243 
3244 /*put a pixel, given its RGBA16 color, into image of any color 16-bitdepth type*/
3245 static void rgba16ToPixel(unsigned char* out, size_t i,
3246  const LodePNGColorMode* mode,
3247  unsigned short r, unsigned short g, unsigned short b, unsigned short a) {
3248  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3249  unsigned short gray = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3250  out[i * 2 + 0] = (gray >> 8) & 255;
3251  out[i * 2 + 1] = gray & 255;
3252  }
3253  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3254  out[i * 6 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3255  out[i * 6 + 1] = r & 255;
3256  out[i * 6 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3257  out[i * 6 + 3] = g & 255;
3258  out[i * 6 + 4] = (b >> 8) & 255;
3259  out[i * 6 + 5] = b & 255;
3260  }
3261  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3262  unsigned short gray = r; /*((unsigned)r + g + b) / 3u;*/
3263  out[i * 4 + 0] = (gray >> 8) & 255;
3264  out[i * 4 + 1] = gray & 255;
3265  out[i * 4 + 2] = (a >> 8) & 255;
3266  out[i * 4 + 3] = a & 255;
3267  }
3268  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3269  out[i * 8 + 0] = (r >> 8) & 255;
3270  out[i * 8 + 1] = r & 255;
3271  out[i * 8 + 2] = (g >> 8) & 255;
3272  out[i * 8 + 3] = g & 255;
3273  out[i * 8 + 4] = (b >> 8) & 255;
3274  out[i * 8 + 5] = b & 255;
3275  out[i * 8 + 6] = (a >> 8) & 255;
3276  out[i * 8 + 7] = a & 255;
3277  }
3278 }
3279 
3280 /*Get RGBA8 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with given color type.*/
3281 static void getPixelColorRGBA8(unsigned char* r, unsigned char* g,
3282  unsigned char* b, unsigned char* a,
3283  const unsigned char* in, size_t i,
3284  const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3285  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3286  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3287  *r = *g = *b = in[i];
3288  if (mode->key_defined && *r == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3289  else *a = 255;
3290  }
3291  else if (mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3292  *r = *g = *b = in[i * 2 + 0];
3293  if (mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3294  else *a = 255;
3295  }
3296  else {
3297  unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3298  size_t j = i * mode->bitdepth;
3299  unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3300  *r = *g = *b = (value * 255) / highest;
3301  if (mode->key_defined && value == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3302  else *a = 255;
3303  }
3304  }
3305  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3306  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3307  *r = in[i * 3 + 0]; *g = in[i * 3 + 1]; *b = in[i * 3 + 2];
3308  if (mode->key_defined && *r == mode->key_r && *g == mode->key_g && *b == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3309  else *a = 255;
3310  }
3311  else {
3312  *r = in[i * 6 + 0];
3313  *g = in[i * 6 + 2];
3314  *b = in[i * 6 + 4];
3315  if (mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3316  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3317  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3318  else *a = 255;
3319  }
3320  }
3321  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3322  unsigned index;
3323  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) index = in[i];
3324  else {
3325  size_t j = i * mode->bitdepth;
3326  index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3327  }
3328  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3329  *r = mode->palette[index * 4 + 0];
3330  *g = mode->palette[index * 4 + 1];
3331  *b = mode->palette[index * 4 + 2];
3332  *a = mode->palette[index * 4 + 3];
3333  }
3334  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3335  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3336  *r = *g = *b = in[i * 2 + 0];
3337  *a = in[i * 2 + 1];
3338  }
3339  else {
3340  *r = *g = *b = in[i * 4 + 0];
3341  *a = in[i * 4 + 2];
3342  }
3343  }
3344  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3345  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3346  *r = in[i * 4 + 0];
3347  *g = in[i * 4 + 1];
3348  *b = in[i * 4 + 2];
3349  *a = in[i * 4 + 3];
3350  }
3351  else {
3352  *r = in[i * 8 + 0];
3353  *g = in[i * 8 + 2];
3354  *b = in[i * 8 + 4];
3355  *a = in[i * 8 + 6];
3356  }
3357  }
3358 }
3359 
3360 /*Similar to getPixelColorRGBA8, but with all the for loops inside of the color
3361 mode test cases, optimized to convert the colors much faster, when converting
3362 to the common case of RGBA with 8 bit per channel. buffer must be RGBA with
3363 enough memory.*/
3364 static void getPixelColorsRGBA8(unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT buffer, size_t numpixels,
3365  const unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT in,
3366  const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3367  unsigned num_channels = 4;
3368  size_t i;
3369  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3370  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3371  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3372  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i];
3373  buffer[3] = 255;
3374  }
3375  if (mode->key_defined) {
3376  buffer -= numpixels * num_channels;
3377  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3378  if (buffer[0] == mode->key_r) buffer[3] = 0;
3379  }
3380  }
3381  }
3382  else if (mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3383  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3384  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2];
3385  buffer[3] = mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r ? 0 : 255;
3386  }
3387  }
3388  else {
3389  unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3390  size_t j = 0;
3391  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3392  unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3393  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = (value * 255) / highest;
3394  buffer[3] = mode->key_defined && value == mode->key_r ? 0 : 255;
3395  }
3396  }
3397  }
3398  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3399  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3400  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3401  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &in[i * 3], 3);
3402  buffer[3] = 255;
3403  }
3404  if (mode->key_defined) {
3405  buffer -= numpixels * num_channels;
3406  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3407  if (buffer[0] == mode->key_r && buffer[1] == mode->key_g && buffer[2] == mode->key_b) buffer[3] = 0;
3408  }
3409  }
3410  }
3411  else {
3412  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3413  buffer[0] = in[i * 6 + 0];
3414  buffer[1] = in[i * 6 + 2];
3415  buffer[2] = in[i * 6 + 4];
3416  buffer[3] = mode->key_defined
3417  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3418  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3419  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b ? 0 : 255;
3420  }
3421  }
3422  }
3423  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3424  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3425  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3426  unsigned index = in[i];
3427  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3428  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3429  }
3430  }
3431  else {
3432  size_t j = 0;
3433  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3434  unsigned index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3435  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3436  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3437  }
3438  }
3439  }
3440  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3441  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3442  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3443  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2 + 0];
3444  buffer[3] = in[i * 2 + 1];
3445  }
3446  }
3447  else {
3448  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3449  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 4 + 0];
3450  buffer[3] = in[i * 4 + 2];
3451  }
3452  }
3453  }
3454  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3455  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3456  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, in, numpixels * 4);
3457  }
3458  else {
3459  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3460  buffer[0] = in[i * 8 + 0];
3461  buffer[1] = in[i * 8 + 2];
3462  buffer[2] = in[i * 8 + 4];
3463  buffer[3] = in[i * 8 + 6];
3464  }
3465  }
3466  }
3467 }
3468 
3469 /*Similar to getPixelColorsRGBA8, but with 3-channel RGB output.*/
3470 static void getPixelColorsRGB8(unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT buffer, size_t numpixels,
3471  const unsigned char* LODEPNG_RESTRICT in,
3472  const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3473  const unsigned num_channels = 3;
3474  size_t i;
3475  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3476  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3477  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3478  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i];
3479  }
3480  }
3481  else if (mode->bitdepth == 16) {
3482  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3483  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2];
3484  }
3485  }
3486  else {
3487  unsigned highest = ((1U << mode->bitdepth) - 1U); /*highest possible value for this bit depth*/
3488  size_t j = 0;
3489  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3490  unsigned value = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3491  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = (value * 255) / highest;
3492  }
3493  }
3494  }
3495  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3496  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3497  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, in, numpixels * 3);
3498  }
3499  else {
3500  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3501  buffer[0] = in[i * 6 + 0];
3502  buffer[1] = in[i * 6 + 2];
3503  buffer[2] = in[i * 6 + 4];
3504  }
3505  }
3506  }
3507  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3508  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3509  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3510  unsigned index = in[i];
3511  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3512  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 3);
3513  }
3514  }
3515  else {
3516  size_t j = 0;
3517  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3518  unsigned index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3519  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3520  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 3);
3521  }
3522  }
3523  }
3524  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3525  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3526  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3527  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2 + 0];
3528  }
3529  }
3530  else {
3531  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3532  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 4 + 0];
3533  }
3534  }
3535  }
3536  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3537  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3538  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3539  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &in[i * 4], 3);
3540  }
3541  }
3542  else {
3543  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3544  buffer[0] = in[i * 8 + 0];
3545  buffer[1] = in[i * 8 + 2];
3546  buffer[2] = in[i * 8 + 4];
3547  }
3548  }
3549  }
3550 }
3551 
3552 /*Get RGBA16 color of pixel with index i (y * width + x) from the raw image with
3553 given color type, but the given color type must be 16-bit itself.*/
3554 static void getPixelColorRGBA16(unsigned short* r, unsigned short* g, unsigned short* b, unsigned short* a,
3555  const unsigned char* in, size_t i, const LodePNGColorMode* mode) {
3556  if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
3557  *r = *g = *b = 256 * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1];
3558  if (mode->key_defined && 256U * in[i * 2 + 0] + in[i * 2 + 1] == mode->key_r) *a = 0;
3559  else *a = 65535;
3560  }
3561  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3562  *r = 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1];
3563  *g = 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3];
3564  *b = 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5];
3565  if (mode->key_defined
3566  && 256u * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3567  && 256u * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3568  && 256u * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b) *a = 0;
3569  else *a = 65535;
3570  }
3571  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3572  *r = *g = *b = 256u * in[i * 4 + 0] + in[i * 4 + 1];
3573  *a = 256u * in[i * 4 + 2] + in[i * 4 + 3];
3574  }
3575  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3576  *r = 256u * in[i * 8 + 0] + in[i * 8 + 1];
3577  *g = 256u * in[i * 8 + 2] + in[i * 8 + 3];
3578  *b = 256u * in[i * 8 + 4] + in[i * 8 + 5];
3579  *a = 256u * in[i * 8 + 6] + in[i * 8 + 7];
3580  }
3581 }
3582 
3583 unsigned lodepng_convert(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
3584  const LodePNGColorMode* mode_out, const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in,
3585  unsigned w, unsigned h) {
3586  size_t i;
3587  ColorTree tree;
3588  size_t numpixels = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
3589  unsigned error = 0;
3590 
3591  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && !mode_in->palette) {
3592  return 107; /* error: must provide palette if input mode is palette */
3593  }
3594 
3595  if (lodepng_color_mode_equal(mode_out, mode_in)) {
3596  size_t numbytes = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, mode_in);
3597  lodepng_memcpy(out, in, numbytes);
3598  return 0;
3599  }
3600 
3601  if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3602  size_t palettesize = mode_out->palettesize;
3603  const unsigned char* palette = mode_out->palette;
3604  size_t palsize = (size_t)1u << mode_out->bitdepth;
3605  /*if the user specified output palette but did not give the values, assume
3606  they want the values of the input color type (assuming that one is palette).
3607  Note that we never create a new palette ourselves.*/
3608  if (palettesize == 0) {
3609  palettesize = mode_in->palettesize;
3610  palette = mode_in->palette;
3611  /*if the input was also palette with same bitdepth, then the color types are also
3612  equal, so copy literally. This to preserve the exact indices that were in the PNG
3613  even in case there are duplicate colors in the palette.*/
3614  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth) {
3615  size_t numbytes = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, mode_in);
3616  lodepng_memcpy(out, in, numbytes);
3617  return 0;
3618  }
3619  }
3620  if (palettesize < palsize) palsize = palettesize;
3621  color_tree_init(&tree);
3622  for (i = 0; i != palsize; ++i) {
3623  const unsigned char* p = &palette[i * 4];
3624  error = color_tree_add(&tree, p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], (unsigned)i);
3625  if (error) break;
3626  }
3627  }
3628 
3629  if (!error) {
3630  if (mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && mode_out->bitdepth == 16) {
3631  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3632  unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3633  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3634  rgba16ToPixel(out, i, mode_out, r, g, b, a);
3635  }
3636  }
3637  else if (mode_out->bitdepth == 8 && mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3638  getPixelColorsRGBA8(out, numpixels, in, mode_in);
3639  }
3640  else if (mode_out->bitdepth == 8 && mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
3641  getPixelColorsRGB8(out, numpixels, in, mode_in);
3642  }
3643  else {
3644  unsigned char r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3645  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3646  getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3647  error = rgba8ToPixel(out, i, mode_out, &tree, r, g, b, a);
3648  if (error) break;
3649  }
3650  }
3651  }
3652 
3653  if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3654  color_tree_cleanup(&tree);
3655  }
3656 
3657  return error;
3658 }
3659 
3660 
3661 /* Converts a single rgb color without alpha from one type to another, color bits truncated to
3662 their bitdepth. In case of single channel (gray or palette), only the r channel is used. Slow
3663 function, do not use to process all pixels of an image. Alpha channel not supported on purpose:
3664 this is for bKGD, supporting alpha may prevent it from finding a color in the palette, from the
3665 specification it looks like bKGD should ignore the alpha values of the palette since it can use
3666 any palette index but doesn't have an alpha channel. Idem with ignoring color key. */
3667 unsigned lodepng_convert_rgb(
3668  unsigned* r_out, unsigned* g_out, unsigned* b_out,
3669  unsigned r_in, unsigned g_in, unsigned b_in,
3670  const LodePNGColorMode* mode_out, const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in) {
3671  unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
3672  unsigned mul = 65535 / ((1u << mode_in->bitdepth) - 1u); /*65535, 21845, 4369, 257, 1*/
3673  unsigned shift = 16 - mode_out->bitdepth;
3674 
3675  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3676  r = g = b = r_in * mul;
3677  }
3678  else if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3679  r = r_in * mul;
3680  g = g_in * mul;
3681  b = b_in * mul;
3682  }
3683  else if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3684  if (r_in >= mode_in->palettesize) return 82;
3685  r = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 0] * 257u;
3686  g = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 1] * 257u;
3687  b = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 2] * 257u;
3688  }
3689  else {
3690  return 31;
3691  }
3692 
3693  /* now convert to output format */
3694  if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3695  *r_out = r >> shift;
3696  }
3697  else if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3698  *r_out = r >> shift;
3699  *g_out = g >> shift;
3700  *b_out = b >> shift;
3701  }
3702  else if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3703  unsigned i;
3704  /* a 16-bit color cannot be in the palette */
3705  if ((r >> 8) != (r & 255) || (g >> 8) != (g & 255) || (b >> 8) != (b & 255)) return 82;
3706  for (i = 0; i < mode_out->palettesize; i++) {
3707  unsigned j = i * 4;
3708  if ((r >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 0] && (g >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 1] &&
3709  (b >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 2]) {
3710  *r_out = i;
3711  return 0;
3712  }
3713  }
3714  return 82;
3715  }
3716  else {
3717  return 31;
3718  }
3719 
3720  return 0;
3721 }
3722 
3723 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
3724 
3725 void lodepng_color_stats_init(LodePNGColorStats* stats) {
3726  /*stats*/
3727  stats->colored = 0;
3728  stats->key = 0;
3729  stats->key_r = stats->key_g = stats->key_b = 0;
3730  stats->alpha = 0;
3731  stats->numcolors = 0;
3732  stats->bits = 1;
3733  stats->numpixels = 0;
3734  /*settings*/
3735  stats->allow_palette = 1;
3736  stats->allow_greyscale = 1;
3737 }
3738 
3739 /*function used for debug purposes with C++*/
3740 /*void printColorStats(LodePNGColorStats* p) {
3741  std::cout << "colored: " << (int)p->colored << ", ";
3742  std::cout << "key: " << (int)p->key << ", ";
3743  std::cout << "key_r: " << (int)p->key_r << ", ";
3744  std::cout << "key_g: " << (int)p->key_g << ", ";
3745  std::cout << "key_b: " << (int)p->key_b << ", ";
3746  std::cout << "alpha: " << (int)p->alpha << ", ";
3747  std::cout << "numcolors: " << (int)p->numcolors << ", ";
3748  std::cout << "bits: " << (int)p->bits << std::endl;
3749 }*/
3750 
3751 /*Returns how many bits needed to represent given value (max 8 bit)*/
3752 static unsigned getValueRequiredBits(unsigned char value) {
3753  if (value == 0 || value == 255) return 1;
3754  /*The scaling of 2-bit and 4-bit values uses multiples of 85 and 17*/
3755  if (value % 17 == 0) return value % 85 == 0 ? 2 : 4;
3756  return 8;
3757 }
3758 
3759 /*stats must already have been inited. */
3760 unsigned lodepng_compute_color_stats(LodePNGColorStats* stats,
3761  const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
3762  const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in) {
3763  size_t i;
3764  ColorTree tree;
3765  size_t numpixels = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
3766  unsigned error = 0;
3767 
3768  /* mark things as done already if it would be impossible to have a more expensive case */
3769  unsigned colored_done = lodepng_is_greyscale_type(mode_in) ? 1 : 0;
3770  unsigned alpha_done = lodepng_can_have_alpha(mode_in) ? 0 : 1;
3771  unsigned numcolors_done = 0;
3772  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(mode_in);
3773  unsigned bits_done = (stats->bits == 1 && bpp == 1) ? 1 : 0;
3774  unsigned sixteen = 0; /* whether the input image is 16 bit */
3775  unsigned maxnumcolors = 257;
3776  if (bpp <= 8) maxnumcolors = LODEPNG_MIN(257, stats->numcolors + (1u << bpp));
3777 
3778  stats->numpixels += numpixels;
3779 
3780  /*if palette not allowed, no need to compute numcolors*/
3781  if (!stats->allow_palette) numcolors_done = 1;
3782 
3783  color_tree_init(&tree);
3784 
3785  /*If the stats was already filled in from previous data, fill its palette in tree
3786  and mark things as done already if we know they are the most expensive case already*/
3787  if (stats->alpha) alpha_done = 1;
3788  if (stats->colored) colored_done = 1;
3789  if (stats->bits == 16) numcolors_done = 1;
3790  if (stats->bits >= bpp) bits_done = 1;
3791  if (stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors) numcolors_done = 1;
3792 
3793  if (!numcolors_done) {
3794  for (i = 0; i < stats->numcolors; i++) {
3795  const unsigned char* color = &stats->palette[i * 4];
3796  error = color_tree_add(&tree, color[0], color[1], color[2], color[3], i);
3797  if (error) goto cleanup;
3798  }
3799  }
3800 
3801  /*Check if the 16-bit input is truly 16-bit*/
3802  if (mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && !sixteen) {
3803  unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3804  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3805  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3806  if ((r & 255) != ((r >> 8) & 255) || (g & 255) != ((g >> 8) & 255) ||
3807  (b & 255) != ((b >> 8) & 255) || (a & 255) != ((a >> 8) & 255)) /*first and second byte differ*/ {
3808  stats->bits = 16;
3809  sixteen = 1;
3810  bits_done = 1;
3811  numcolors_done = 1; /*counting colors no longer useful, palette doesn't support 16-bit*/
3812  break;
3813  }
3814  }
3815  }
3816 
3817  if (sixteen) {
3818  unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3819 
3820  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3821  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3822 
3823  if (!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3824  stats->colored = 1;
3825  colored_done = 1;
3826  }
3827 
3828  if (!alpha_done) {
3829  unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3830  if (a != 65535 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3831  stats->alpha = 1;
3832  stats->key = 0;
3833  alpha_done = 1;
3834  }
3835  else if (a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3836  stats->key = 1;
3837  stats->key_r = r;
3838  stats->key_g = g;
3839  stats->key_b = b;
3840  }
3841  else if (a == 65535 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3842  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3843  stats->alpha = 1;
3844  stats->key = 0;
3845  alpha_done = 1;
3846  }
3847  }
3848  if (alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3849  }
3850 
3851  if (stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3852  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3853  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3854  if (a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3855  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3856  stats->alpha = 1;
3857  stats->key = 0;
3858  alpha_done = 1;
3859  }
3860  }
3861  }
3862  }
3863  else /* < 16-bit */ {
3864  unsigned char r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3865  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3866  getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3867 
3868  if (!bits_done && stats->bits < 8) {
3869  /*only r is checked, < 8 bits is only relevant for grayscale*/
3870  unsigned bits = getValueRequiredBits(r);
3871  if (bits > stats->bits) stats->bits = bits;
3872  }
3873  bits_done = (stats->bits >= bpp);
3874 
3875  if (!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3876  stats->colored = 1;
3877  colored_done = 1;
3878  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no colored modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3879  }
3880 
3881  if (!alpha_done) {
3882  unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3883  if (a != 255 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3884  stats->alpha = 1;
3885  stats->key = 0;
3886  alpha_done = 1;
3887  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3888  }
3889  else if (a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3890  stats->key = 1;
3891  stats->key_r = r;
3892  stats->key_g = g;
3893  stats->key_b = b;
3894  }
3895  else if (a == 255 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3896  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3897  stats->alpha = 1;
3898  stats->key = 0;
3899  alpha_done = 1;
3900  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  if (!numcolors_done) {
3905  if (!color_tree_has(&tree, r, g, b, a)) {
3906  error = color_tree_add(&tree, r, g, b, a, stats->numcolors);
3907  if (error) goto cleanup;
3908  if (stats->numcolors < 256) {
3909  unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
3910  unsigned n = stats->numcolors;
3911  p[n * 4 + 0] = r;
3912  p[n * 4 + 1] = g;
3913  p[n * 4 + 2] = b;
3914  p[n * 4 + 3] = a;
3915  }
3916  ++stats->numcolors;
3917  numcolors_done = stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors;
3918  }
3919  }
3920 
3921  if (alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3922  }
3923 
3924  if (stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3925  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3926  getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3927  if (a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3928  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3929  stats->alpha = 1;
3930  stats->key = 0;
3931  alpha_done = 1;
3932  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3933  }
3934  }
3935  }
3936 
3937  /*make the stats's key always 16-bit for consistency - repeat each byte twice*/
3938  stats->key_r += (stats->key_r << 8);
3939  stats->key_g += (stats->key_g << 8);
3940  stats->key_b += (stats->key_b << 8);
3941  }
3942 
3943 cleanup:
3944  color_tree_cleanup(&tree);
3945  return error;
3946 }
3947 
3948 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
3949 /*Adds a single color to the color stats. The stats must already have been inited. The color must be given as 16-bit
3950 (with 2 bytes repeating for 8-bit and 65535 for opaque alpha channel). This function is expensive, do not call it for
3951 all pixels of an image but only for a few additional values. */
