3952 static unsigned lodepng_color_stats_add(LodePNGColorStats* stats,
3953  unsigned r, unsigned g, unsigned b, unsigned a) {
3954  unsigned error = 0;
3955  unsigned char image[8];
3956  LodePNGColorMode mode;
3957  lodepng_color_mode_init(&mode);
3958  image[0] = r >> 8; image[1] = r; image[2] = g >> 8; image[3] = g;
3959  image[4] = b >> 8; image[5] = b; image[6] = a >> 8; image[7] = a;
3960  mode.bitdepth = 16;
3961  mode.colortype = LCT_RGBA;
3962  error = lodepng_compute_color_stats(stats, image, 1, 1, &mode);
3963  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&mode);
3964  return error;
3965 }
3966 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
3967 
3968 /*Computes a minimal PNG color model that can contain all colors as indicated by the stats.
3969 The stats should be computed with lodepng_compute_color_stats.
3970 mode_in is raw color profile of the image the stats were computed on, to copy palette order from when relevant.
3971 Minimal PNG color model means the color type and bit depth that gives smallest amount of bits in the output image,
3972 e.g. gray if only grayscale pixels, palette if less than 256 colors, color key if only single transparent color, ...
3973 This is used if auto_convert is enabled (it is by default).
3974 */
3975 static unsigned auto_choose_color(LodePNGColorMode* mode_out,
3976  const LodePNGColorMode* mode_in,
3977  const LodePNGColorStats* stats) {
3978  unsigned error = 0;
3979  unsigned palettebits;
3980  size_t i, n;
3981  size_t numpixels = stats->numpixels;
3982  unsigned palette_ok, gray_ok;
3983 
3984  unsigned alpha = stats->alpha;
3985  unsigned key = stats->key;
3986  unsigned bits = stats->bits;
3987 
3988  mode_out->key_defined = 0;
3989 
3990  if (key && numpixels <= 16) {
3991  alpha = 1; /*too few pixels to justify tRNS chunk overhead*/
3992  key = 0;
3993  if (bits < 8) bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3994  }
3995 
3996  gray_ok = !stats->colored;
3997  if (!stats->allow_greyscale) gray_ok = 0;
3998  if (!gray_ok && bits < 8) bits = 8;
3999 
4000  n = stats->numcolors;
4001  palettebits = n <= 2 ? 1 : (n <= 4 ? 2 : (n <= 16 ? 4 : 8));
4002  palette_ok = n <= 256 && bits <= 8 && n != 0; /*n==0 means likely numcolors wasn't computed*/
4003  if (numpixels < n * 2) palette_ok = 0; /*don't add palette overhead if image has only a few pixels*/
4004  if (gray_ok && !alpha && bits <= palettebits) palette_ok = 0; /*gray is less overhead*/
4005  if (!stats->allow_palette) palette_ok = 0;
4006 
4007  if (palette_ok) {
4008  const unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
4009  lodepng_palette_clear(mode_out); /*remove potential earlier palette*/
4010  for (i = 0; i != stats->numcolors; ++i) {
4011  error = lodepng_palette_add(mode_out, p[i * 4 + 0], p[i * 4 + 1], p[i * 4 + 2], p[i * 4 + 3]);
4012  if (error) break;
4013  }
4014 
4015  mode_out->colortype = LCT_PALETTE;
4016  mode_out->bitdepth = palettebits;
4017 
4018  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->palettesize >= mode_out->palettesize
4019  && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth) {
4020  /*If input should have same palette colors, keep original to preserve its order and prevent conversion*/
4021  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(mode_out);
4022  lodepng_color_mode_copy(mode_out, mode_in);
4023  }
4024  }
4025  else /*8-bit or 16-bit per channel*/ {
4026  mode_out->bitdepth = bits;
4027  mode_out->colortype = alpha ? (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY_ALPHA : LCT_RGBA)
4028  : (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY : LCT_RGB);
4029  if (key) {
4030  unsigned mask = (1u << mode_out->bitdepth) - 1u; /*stats always uses 16-bit, mask converts it*/
4031  mode_out->key_r = stats->key_r & mask;
4032  mode_out->key_g = stats->key_g & mask;
4033  mode_out->key_b = stats->key_b & mask;
4034  mode_out->key_defined = 1;
4035  }
4036  }
4037 
4038  return error;
4039 }
4040 
4041 #endif /* #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
4042 
4043 /*
4044 Paeth predictor, used by PNG filter type 4
4045 The parameters are of type short, but should come from unsigned chars, the shorts
4046 are only needed to make the paeth calculation correct.
4047 */
4048 static unsigned char paethPredictor(short a, short b, short c) {
4049  short pa = LODEPNG_ABS(b - c);
4050  short pb = LODEPNG_ABS(a - c);
4051  short pc = LODEPNG_ABS(a + b - c - c);
4052  /* return input value associated with smallest of pa, pb, pc (with certain priority if equal) */
4053  if (pb < pa) { a = b; pa = pb; }
4054  return (pc < pa) ? c : a;
4055 }
4056 
4057 /*shared values used by multiple Adam7 related functions*/
4058 
4059 static const unsigned ADAM7_IX[7] = { 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1, 0 }; /*x start values*/
4060 static const unsigned ADAM7_IY[7] = { 0, 0, 4, 0, 2, 0, 1 }; /*y start values*/
4061 static const unsigned ADAM7_DX[7] = { 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2, 1 }; /*x delta values*/
4062 static const unsigned ADAM7_DY[7] = { 8, 8, 8, 4, 4, 2, 2 }; /*y delta values*/
4063 
4064 /*
4065 Outputs various dimensions and positions in the image related to the Adam7 reduced images.
4066 passw: output containing the width of the 7 passes
4067 passh: output containing the height of the 7 passes
4068 filter_passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each
4069  reduced image with filter bytes
4070 padded_passstart output containing the index of the start and end of each
4071  reduced image when without filter bytes but with padded scanlines
4072 passstart: output containing the index of the start and end of each reduced
4073  image without padding between scanlines, but still padding between the images
4074 w, h: width and height of non-interlaced image
4075 bpp: bits per pixel
4076 "padded" is only relevant if bpp is less than 8 and a scanline or image does not
4077  end at a full byte
4078 */
4079 static void Adam7_getpassvalues(unsigned passw[7], unsigned passh[7], size_t filter_passstart[8],
4080  size_t padded_passstart[8], size_t passstart[8], unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4081  /*the passstart values have 8 values: the 8th one indicates the byte after the end of the 7th (= last) pass*/
4082  unsigned i;
4083 
4084  /*calculate width and height in pixels of each pass*/
4085  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4086  passw[i] = (w + ADAM7_DX[i] - ADAM7_IX[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DX[i];
4087  passh[i] = (h + ADAM7_DY[i] - ADAM7_IY[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DY[i];
4088  if (passw[i] == 0) passh[i] = 0;
4089  if (passh[i] == 0) passw[i] = 0;
4090  }
4091 
4092  filter_passstart[0] = padded_passstart[0] = passstart[0] = 0;
4093  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4094  /*if passw[i] is 0, it's 0 bytes, not 1 (no filtertype-byte)*/
4095  filter_passstart[i + 1] = filter_passstart[i]
4096  + ((passw[i] && passh[i]) ? passh[i] * (1u + (passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) : 0);
4097  /*bits padded if needed to fill full byte at end of each scanline*/
4098  padded_passstart[i + 1] = padded_passstart[i] + passh[i] * ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u);
4099  /*only padded at end of reduced image*/
4100  passstart[i + 1] = passstart[i] + (passh[i] * passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4101  }
4102 }
4103 
4104 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
4105 
4106 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
4107 /* / PNG Decoder / */
4108 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
4109 
4110 /*read the information from the header and store it in the LodePNGInfo. return value is error*/
4111 unsigned lodepng_inspect(unsigned* w, unsigned* h, LodePNGState* state,
4112  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4113  unsigned width, height;
4114  LodePNGInfo* info = &state->info_png;
4115  if (insize == 0 || in == 0) {
4116  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 48); /*error: the given data is empty*/
4117  }
4118  if (insize < 33) {
4119  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 27); /*error: the data length is smaller than the length of a PNG header*/
4120  }
4121 
4122  /*when decoding a new PNG image, make sure all parameters created after previous decoding are reset*/
4123  /* TODO: remove this. One should use a new LodePNGState for new sessions */
4124  lodepng_info_cleanup(info);
4125  lodepng_info_init(info);
4126 
4127  if (in[0] != 137 || in[1] != 80 || in[2] != 78 || in[3] != 71
4128  || in[4] != 13 || in[5] != 10 || in[6] != 26 || in[7] != 10) {
4129  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 28); /*error: the first 8 bytes are not the correct PNG signature*/
4130  }
4131  if (lodepng_chunk_length(in + 8) != 13) {
4132  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 94); /*error: header size must be 13 bytes*/
4133  }
4134  if (!lodepng_chunk_type_equals(in + 8, "IHDR")) {
4135  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 29); /*error: it doesn't start with a IHDR chunk!*/
4136  }
4137 
4138  /*read the values given in the header*/
4139  width = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[16]);
4140  height = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[20]);
4141  /*TODO: remove the undocumented feature that allows to give null pointers to width or height*/
4142  if (w) *w = width;
4143  if (h) *h = height;
4144  info->color.bitdepth = in[24];
4145  info->color.colortype = (LodePNGColorType)in[25];
4146  info->compression_method = in[26];
4147  info->filter_method = in[27];
4148  info->interlace_method = in[28];
4149 
4150  /*errors returned only after the parsing so other values are still output*/
4151 
4152  /*error: invalid image size*/
4153  if (width == 0 || height == 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 93);
4154  /*error: invalid colortype or bitdepth combination*/
4155  state->error = checkColorValidity(info->color.colortype, info->color.bitdepth);
4156  if (state->error) return state->error;
4157  /*error: only compression method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4158  if (info->compression_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 32);
4159  /*error: only filter method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4160  if (info->filter_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 33);
4161  /*error: only interlace methods 0 and 1 exist in the specification*/
4162  if (info->interlace_method > 1) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 34);
4163 
4164  if (!state->decoder.ignore_crc) {
4165  unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[29]);
4166  unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&in[12], 17);
4167  if (CRC != checksum) {
4168  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
4169  }
4170  }
4171 
4172  return state->error;
4173 }
4174 
4175 static unsigned unfilterScanline(unsigned char* recon, const unsigned char* scanline, const unsigned char* precon,
4176  size_t bytewidth, unsigned char filterType, size_t length) {
4177  /*
4178  For PNG filter method 0
4179  unfilter a PNG image scanline by scanline. when the pixels are smaller than 1 byte,
4180  the filter works byte per byte (bytewidth = 1)
4181  precon is the previous unfiltered scanline, recon the result, scanline the current one
4182  the incoming scanlines do NOT include the filtertype byte, that one is given in the parameter filterType instead
4183  recon and scanline MAY be the same memory address! precon must be disjoint.
4184  */
4185 
4186  size_t i;
4187  switch (filterType) {
4188  case 0:
4189  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4190  break;
4191  case 1:
4192  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4193  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth];
4194  break;
4195  case 2:
4196  if (precon) {
4197  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + precon[i];
4198  }
4199  else {
4200  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4201  }
4202  break;
4203  case 3:
4204  if (precon) {
4205  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (precon[i] >> 1u);
4206  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + ((recon[i - bytewidth] + precon[i]) >> 1u);
4207  }
4208  else {
4209  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4210  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (recon[i - bytewidth] >> 1u);
4211  }
4212  break;
4213  case 4:
4214  if (precon) {
4215  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4216  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + precon[i]); /*paethPredictor(0, precon[i], 0) is always precon[i]*/
4217  }
4218 
4219  /* Unroll independent paths of the paeth predictor. A 6x and 8x version would also be possible but that
4220  adds too much code. Whether this actually speeds anything up at all depends on compiler and settings. */
4221  if (bytewidth >= 4) {
4222  for (; i + 3 < length; i += 4) {
4223  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4224  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2], s3 = scanline[i + 3];
4225  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2], r3 = recon[j + 3];
4226  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2], p3 = precon[i + 3];
4227  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2], q3 = precon[j + 3];
4228  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4229  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4230  recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4231  recon[i + 3] = s3 + paethPredictor(r3, p3, q3);
4232  }
4233  }
4234  else if (bytewidth >= 3) {
4235  for (; i + 2 < length; i += 3) {
4236  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4237  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2];
4238  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2];
4239  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2];
4240  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2];
4241  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4242  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4243  recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4244  }
4245  }
4246  else if (bytewidth >= 2) {
4247  for (; i + 1 < length; i += 2) {
4248  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4249  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1];
4250  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1];
4251  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1];
4252  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1];
4253  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4254  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4255  }
4256  }
4257 
4258  for (; i != length; ++i) {
4259  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], precon[i], precon[i - bytewidth]));
4260  }
4261  }
4262  else {
4263  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4264  recon[i] = scanline[i];
4265  }
4266  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) {
4267  /*paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always recon[i - bytewidth]*/
4268  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth]);
4269  }
4270  }
4271  break;
4272  default: return 36; /*error: invalid filter type given*/
4273  }
4274  return 0;
4275 }
4276 
4277 static unsigned unfilter(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4278  /*
4279  For PNG filter method 0
4280  this function unfilters a single image (e.g. without interlacing this is called once, with Adam7 seven times)
4281  out must have enough bytes allocated already, in must have the scanlines + 1 filtertype byte per scanline
4282  w and h are image dimensions or dimensions of reduced image, bpp is bits per pixel
4283  in and out are allowed to be the same memory address (but aren't the same size since in has the extra filter bytes)
4284  */
4285 
4286  unsigned y;
4287  unsigned char* prevline = 0;
4288 
4289  /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
4290  size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4291  /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
4292  size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
4293 
4294  for (y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4295  size_t outindex = linebytes * y;
4296  size_t inindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
4297  unsigned char filterType = in[inindex];
4298 
4299  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilterScanline(&out[outindex], &in[inindex + 1], prevline, bytewidth, filterType, linebytes));
4300 
4301  prevline = &out[outindex];
4302  }
4303 
4304  return 0;
4305 }
4306 
4307 /*
4308 in: Adam7 interlaced image, with no padding bits between scanlines, but between
4309  reduced images so that each reduced image starts at a byte.
4310 out: the same pixels, but re-ordered so that they're now a non-interlaced image with size w*h
4311 bpp: bits per pixel
4312 out has the following size in bits: w * h * bpp.
4313 in is possibly bigger due to padding bits between reduced images.
4314 out must be big enough AND must be 0 everywhere if bpp < 8 in the current implementation
4315 (because that's likely a little bit faster)
4316 NOTE: comments about padding bits are only relevant if bpp < 8
4317 */
4318 static void Adam7_deinterlace(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
4319  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
4320  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4321  unsigned i;
4322 
4323  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4324 
4325  if (bpp >= 8) {
4326  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4327  unsigned x, y, b;
4328  size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8u;
4329  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4330  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4331  size_t pixelinstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
4332  size_t pixeloutstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * (size_t)w
4333  + ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
4334  for (b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b) {
4335  out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
4336  }
4337  }
4338  }
4339  }
4340  else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/ {
4341  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4342  unsigned x, y, b;
4343  unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
4344  unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
4345  size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
4346  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4347  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4348  ibp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
4349  obp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
4350  for (b = 0; b < bpp; ++b) {
4351  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4352  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4353  }
4354  }
4355  }
4356  }
4357 }
4358 
4359 static void removePaddingBits(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
4360  size_t olinebits, size_t ilinebits, unsigned h) {
4361  /*
4362  After filtering there are still padding bits if scanlines have non multiple of 8 bit amounts. They need
4363  to be removed (except at last scanline of (Adam7-reduced) image) before working with pure image buffers
4364  for the Adam7 code, the color convert code and the output to the user.
4365  in and out are allowed to be the same buffer, in may also be higher but still overlapping; in must
4366  have >= ilinebits*h bits, out must have >= olinebits*h bits, olinebits must be <= ilinebits
4367  also used to move bits after earlier such operations happened, e.g. in a sequence of reduced images from Adam7
4368  only useful if (ilinebits - olinebits) is a value in the range 1..7
4369  */
4370  unsigned y;
4371  size_t diff = ilinebits - olinebits;
4372  size_t ibp = 0, obp = 0; /*input and output bit pointers*/
4373  for (y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4374  size_t x;
4375  for (x = 0; x < olinebits; ++x) {
4376  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4377  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4378  }
4379  ibp += diff;
4380  }
4381 }
4382 
4383 /*out must be buffer big enough to contain full image, and in must contain the full decompressed data from
4384 the IDAT chunks (with filter index bytes and possible padding bits)
4385 return value is error*/
4386 static unsigned postProcessScanlines(unsigned char* out, unsigned char* in,
4387  unsigned w, unsigned h, const LodePNGInfo* info_png) {
4388  /*
4389  This function converts the filtered-padded-interlaced data into pure 2D image buffer with the PNG's colortype.
4390  Steps:
4391  *) if no Adam7: 1) unfilter 2) remove padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8)
4392  *) if adam7: 1) 7x unfilter 2) 7x remove padding bits 3) Adam7_deinterlace
4393  NOTE: the in buffer will be overwritten with intermediate data!
4394  */
4395  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
4396  if (bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid colortype*/
4397 
4398  if (info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
4399  if (bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
4400  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(in, in, w, h, bpp));
4401  removePaddingBits(out, in, w * bpp, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, h);
4402  }
4403  /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
4404  else CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(out, in, w, h, bpp));
4405  }
4406  else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
4407  unsigned passw[7], passh[7]; size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4408  unsigned i;
4409 
4410  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4411 
4412  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4413  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(&in[padded_passstart[i]], &in[filter_passstart[i]], passw[i], passh[i], bpp));
4414  /*TODO: possible efficiency improvement: if in this reduced image the bits fit nicely in 1 scanline,
4415  move bytes instead of bits or move not at all*/
4416  if (bpp < 8) {
4417  /*remove padding bits in scanlines; after this there still may be padding
4418  bits between the different reduced images: each reduced image still starts nicely at a byte*/
4419  removePaddingBits(&in[passstart[i]], &in[padded_passstart[i]], passw[i] * bpp,
4420  ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passh[i]);
4421  }
4422  }
4423 
4424  Adam7_deinterlace(out, in, w, h, bpp);
4425  }
4426 
4427  return 0;
4428 }
4429 
4430 static unsigned readChunk_PLTE(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4431  unsigned pos = 0, i;
4432  color->palettesize = chunkLength / 3u;
4433  if (color->palettesize == 0 || color->palettesize > 256) return 38; /*error: palette too small or big*/
4434  lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette(color);
4435  if (!color->palette && color->palettesize) {
4436  color->palettesize = 0;
4437  return 83; /*alloc fail*/
4438  }
4439 
4440  for (i = 0; i != color->palettesize; ++i) {
4441  color->palette[4 * i + 0] = data[pos++]; /*R*/
4442  color->palette[4 * i + 1] = data[pos++]; /*G*/
4443  color->palette[4 * i + 2] = data[pos++]; /*B*/
4444  color->palette[4 * i + 3] = 255; /*alpha*/
4445  }
4446 
4447  return 0; /* OK */
4448 }
4449 
4450 static unsigned readChunk_tRNS(LodePNGColorMode* color, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4451  unsigned i;
4452  if (color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
4453  /*error: more alpha values given than there are palette entries*/
4454  if (chunkLength > color->palettesize) return 39;
4455 
4456  for (i = 0; i != chunkLength; ++i) color->palette[4 * i + 3] = data[i];
4457  }
4458  else if (color->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
4459  /*error: this chunk must be 2 bytes for grayscale image*/
4460  if (chunkLength != 2) return 30;
4461 
4462  color->key_defined = 1;
4463  color->key_r = color->key_g = color->key_b = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4464  }
4465  else if (color->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
4466  /*error: this chunk must be 6 bytes for RGB image*/
4467  if (chunkLength != 6) return 41;
4468 
4469  color->key_defined = 1;
4470  color->key_r = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4471  color->key_g = 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4472  color->key_b = 256u * data[4] + data[5];
4473  }
4474  else return 42; /*error: tRNS chunk not allowed for other color models*/
4475 
4476  return 0; /* OK */
4477 }
4478 
4479 
4480 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4481 /*background color chunk (bKGD)*/
4482 static unsigned readChunk_bKGD(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4483  if (info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
4484  /*error: this chunk must be 1 byte for indexed color image*/
4485  if (chunkLength != 1) return 43;
4486 
4487  /*error: invalid palette index, or maybe this chunk appeared before PLTE*/
4488  if (data[0] >= info->color.palettesize) return 103;
4489 
4490  info->background_defined = 1;
4491  info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = data[0];
4492  }
4493  else if (info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
4494  /*error: this chunk must be 2 bytes for grayscale image*/
4495  if (chunkLength != 2) return 44;
4496 
4497  /*the values are truncated to bitdepth in the PNG file*/
4498  info->background_defined = 1;
4499  info->background_r = info->background_g = info->background_b = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4500  }
4501  else if (info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
4502  /*error: this chunk must be 6 bytes for grayscale image*/
4503  if (chunkLength != 6) return 45;
4504 
4505  /*the values are truncated to bitdepth in the PNG file*/
4506  info->background_defined = 1;
4507  info->background_r = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4508  info->background_g = 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4509  info->background_b = 256u * data[4] + data[5];
4510  }
4511 
4512  return 0; /* OK */
4513 }
4514 
4515 /*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4516 static unsigned readChunk_tEXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4517  unsigned error = 0;
4518  char* key = 0, * str = 0;
4519 
4520  while (!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4521  unsigned length, string2_begin;
4522 
4523  length = 0;
4524  while (length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0) ++length;
4525  /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4526  there's no null termination char, if the text is empty*/
4527  if (length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4528 
4529  key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4530  if (!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4531 
4532  lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4533  key[length] = 0;
4534 
4535  string2_begin = length + 1; /*skip keyword null terminator*/
4536 
4537  length = (unsigned)(chunkLength < string2_begin ? 0 : chunkLength - string2_begin);
4538  str = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4539  if (!str) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4540 
4541  lodepng_memcpy(str, data + string2_begin, length);
4542  str[length] = 0;
4543 
4544  error = lodepng_add_text(info, key, str);
4545 
4546  break;
4547  }
4548 
4549  lodepng_free(key);
4550  lodepng_free(str);
4551 
4552  return error;
4553 }
4554 
4555 /*compressed text chunk (zTXt)*/
4556 static unsigned readChunk_zTXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* zlibsettings,
4557  const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4558  unsigned error = 0;
4559 
4560  unsigned length, string2_begin;
4561  char* key = 0;
4562  unsigned char* str = 0;
4563  size_t size = 0;
4564 
4565  while (!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4566  for (length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length);
4567  if (length + 2 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4568  if (length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4569 
4570  key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4571  if (!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4572 
4573  lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4574  key[length] = 0;
4575 
4576  if (data[length + 1] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4577 
4578  string2_begin = length + 2;
4579  if (string2_begin > chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4580 
4581  length = (unsigned)chunkLength - string2_begin;
4582  /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4583  error = zlib_decompress(&str, &size, 0, &data[string2_begin],
4584  length, zlibsettings);
4585  if (error) break;
4586  error = lodepng_add_text_sized(info, key, (char*)str, size);
4587 
4588  break;
4589  }
4590 
4591  lodepng_free(key);
4592  lodepng_free(str);
4593 
4594  return error;
4595 }
4596 
4597 /*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4598 static unsigned readChunk_iTXt(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* zlibsettings,
4599  const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4600  unsigned error = 0;
4601  unsigned i;
4602 
4603  unsigned length, begin, compressed;
4604  char* key = 0, * langtag = 0, * transkey = 0;
4605 
4606  while (!error) /*not really a while loop, only used to break on error*/ {
4607  /*Quick check if the chunk length isn't too small. Even without check
4608  it'd still fail with other error checks below if it's too short. This just gives a different error code.*/
4609  if (chunkLength < 5) CERROR_BREAK(error, 30); /*iTXt chunk too short*/
4610 
4611  /*read the key*/
4612  for (length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length);
4613  if (length + 3 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination char, corrupt?*/
4614  if (length < 1 || length > 79) CERROR_BREAK(error, 89); /*keyword too short or long*/
4615 
4616  key = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4617  if (!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4618 
4619  lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4620  key[length] = 0;
4621 
4622  /*read the compression method*/
4623  compressed = data[length + 1];
4624  if (data[length + 2] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4625 
4626  /*even though it's not allowed by the standard, no error is thrown if
4627  there's no null termination char, if the text is empty for the next 3 texts*/
4628 
4629  /*read the langtag*/
4630  begin = length + 3;
4631  length = 0;
4632  for (i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4633 
4634  langtag = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4635  if (!langtag) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4636 
4637  lodepng_memcpy(langtag, data + begin, length);
4638  langtag[length] = 0;
4639 
4640  /*read the transkey*/
4641  begin += length + 1;
4642  length = 0;
4643  for (i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;
4644 
4645  transkey = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4646  if (!transkey) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4647 
4648  lodepng_memcpy(transkey, data + begin, length);
4649  transkey[length] = 0;
4650 
4651  /*read the actual text*/
4652  begin += length + 1;
4653 
4654  length = (unsigned)chunkLength < begin ? 0 : (unsigned)chunkLength - begin;
4655 
4656  if (compressed) {
4657  unsigned char* str = 0;
4658  size_t size = 0;
4659  /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4660  error = zlib_decompress(&str, &size, 0, &data[begin],
4661  length, zlibsettings);
4662  if (!error) error = lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)str, size);
4663  lodepng_free(str);
4664  }
4665  else {
4666  error = lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)(data + begin), length);
4667  }
4668 
4669  break;
4670  }
4671 
4672  lodepng_free(key);
4673  lodepng_free(langtag);
4674  lodepng_free(transkey);
4675 
4676  return error;
4677 }
4678 
4679 static unsigned readChunk_tIME(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4680  if (chunkLength != 7) return 73; /*invalid tIME chunk size*/
4681 
4682  info->time_defined = 1;
4683  info->time.year = 256u * data[0] + data[1];
4684  info->time.month = data[2];
4685  info->time.day = data[3];
4686  info->time.hour = data[4];
4687  info->time.minute = data[5];
4688  info->time.second = data[6];
4689 
4690  return 0; /* OK */
4691 }
4692 
4693 static unsigned readChunk_pHYs(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4694  if (chunkLength != 9) return 74; /*invalid pHYs chunk size*/
4695 
4696  info->phys_defined = 1;
4697  info->phys_x = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4698  info->phys_y = 16777216u * data[4] + 65536u * data[5] + 256u * data[6] + data[7];
4699  info->phys_unit = data[8];
4700 
4701  return 0; /* OK */
4702 }
4703 
4704 static unsigned readChunk_gAMA(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4705  if (chunkLength != 4) return 96; /*invalid gAMA chunk size*/
4706 
4707  info->gama_defined = 1;
4708  info->gama_gamma = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4709 
4710  return 0; /* OK */
4711 }
4712 
4713 static unsigned readChunk_cHRM(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4714  if (chunkLength != 32) return 97; /*invalid cHRM chunk size*/
4715 
4716  info->chrm_defined = 1;
4717  info->chrm_white_x = 16777216u * data[0] + 65536u * data[1] + 256u * data[2] + data[3];
4718  info->chrm_white_y = 16777216u * data[4] + 65536u * data[5] + 256u * data[6] + data[7];
4719  info->chrm_red_x = 16777216u * data[8] + 65536u * data[9] + 256u * data[10] + data[11];
4720  info->chrm_red_y = 16777216u * data[12] + 65536u * data[13] + 256u * data[14] + data[15];
4721  info->chrm_green_x = 16777216u * data[16] + 65536u * data[17] + 256u * data[18] + data[19];
4722  info->chrm_green_y = 16777216u * data[20] + 65536u * data[21] + 256u * data[22] + data[23];
4723  info->chrm_blue_x = 16777216u * data[24] + 65536u * data[25] + 256u * data[26] + data[27];
4724  info->chrm_blue_y = 16777216u * data[28] + 65536u * data[29] + 256u * data[30] + data[31];
4725 
4726  return 0; /* OK */
4727 }
4728 
4729 static unsigned readChunk_sRGB(LodePNGInfo* info, const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4730  if (chunkLength != 1) return 98; /*invalid sRGB chunk size (this one is never ignored)*/
4731 
4732  info->srgb_defined = 1;
4733  info->srgb_intent = data[0];
4734 
4735  return 0; /* OK */
4736 }
4737 
4738 static unsigned readChunk_iCCP(LodePNGInfo* info, const LodePNGDecompressSettings* zlibsettings,
4739  const unsigned char* data, size_t chunkLength) {
4740  unsigned error = 0;
4741  unsigned i;
4742  size_t size = 0;
4743 
4744  unsigned length, string2_begin;
4745 
4746  info->iccp_defined = 1;
4747  if (info->iccp_name) lodepng_clear_icc(info);
4748 
4749  for (length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length);
4750  if (length + 2 >= chunkLength) return 75; /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4751  if (length < 1 || length > 79) return 89; /*keyword too short or long*/
4752 
4753  info->iccp_name = (char*)lodepng_malloc(length + 1);
4754  if (!info->iccp_name) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
4755 
4756  info->iccp_name[length] = 0;
4757  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) info->iccp_name[i] = (char)data[i];
4758 
4759  if (data[length + 1] != 0) return 72; /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4760 
4761  string2_begin = length + 2;
4762  if (string2_begin > chunkLength) return 75; /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4763 
4764  length = (unsigned)chunkLength - string2_begin;
4765  error = zlib_decompress(&info->iccp_profile, &size, 0,
4766  &data[string2_begin],
4767  length, zlibsettings);
4768  info->iccp_profile_size = size;
4769  if (!error && !info->iccp_profile_size) error = 100; /*invalid ICC profile size*/
4770  return error;
4771 }
4772 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4773 
4774 unsigned lodepng_inspect_chunk(LodePNGState* state, size_t pos,
4775  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4776  const unsigned char* chunk = in + pos;
4777  unsigned chunkLength;
4778  const unsigned char* data;
4779  unsigned unhandled = 0;
4780  unsigned error = 0;
4781 
4782  if (pos + 4 > insize) return 30;
4783  chunkLength = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
4784  if (chunkLength > 2147483647) return 63;
4785  data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4786  if (data + chunkLength + 4 > in + insize) return 30;
4787 
4788  if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE")) {
4789  error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4790  }
4791  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tRNS")) {
4792  error = readChunk_tRNS(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4793 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4794  }
4795  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "bKGD")) {
4796  error = readChunk_bKGD(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4797  }
4798  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tEXt")) {
4799  error = readChunk_tEXt(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4800  }
4801  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "zTXt")) {
4802  error = readChunk_zTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4803  }
4804  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt")) {
4805  error = readChunk_iTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4806  }
4807  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tIME")) {
4808  error = readChunk_tIME(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4809  }
4810  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "pHYs")) {
4811  error = readChunk_pHYs(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4812  }
4813  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "gAMA")) {
4814  error = readChunk_gAMA(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4815  }
4816  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "cHRM")) {
4817  error = readChunk_cHRM(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4818  }
4819  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sRGB")) {
4820  error = readChunk_sRGB(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4821  }
4822  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iCCP")) {
4823  error = readChunk_iCCP(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4824 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4825  }
4826  else {
4827  /* unhandled chunk is ok (is not an error) */
4828  unhandled = 1;
4829  }
4830 
4831  if (!error && !unhandled && !state->decoder.ignore_crc) {
4832  if (lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) return 57; /*invalid CRC*/
4833  }
4834 
4835  return error;
4836 }
4837 
4838 /*read a PNG, the result will be in the same color type as the PNG (hence "generic")*/
4839 static void decodeGeneric(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
4840  LodePNGState* state,
4841  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
4842  unsigned char IEND = 0;
4843  const unsigned char* chunk;
4844  unsigned char* idat; /*the data from idat chunks, zlib compressed*/
4845  size_t idatsize = 0;
4846  unsigned char* scanlines = 0;
4847  size_t scanlines_size = 0, expected_size = 0;
4848  size_t outsize = 0;
4849 
4850  /*for unknown chunk order*/
4851  unsigned unknown = 0;
4852 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4853  unsigned critical_pos = 1; /*1 = after IHDR, 2 = after PLTE, 3 = after IDAT*/
4854 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4855 
4856 
4857  /* safe output values in case error happens */
4858  * out = 0;
4859  *w = *h = 0;
4860 
4861  state->error = lodepng_inspect(w, h, state, in, insize); /*reads header and resets other parameters in state->info_png*/
4862  if (state->error) return;
4863 
4864  if (lodepng_pixel_overflow(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color, &state->info_raw)) {
4865  CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 92); /*overflow possible due to amount of pixels*/
4866  }
4867 
4868  /*the input filesize is a safe upper bound for the sum of idat chunks size*/
4869  idat = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(insize);
4870  if (!idat) CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4871 
4872  chunk = &in[33]; /*first byte of the first chunk after the header*/
4873 
4874  /*loop through the chunks, ignoring unknown chunks and stopping at IEND chunk.
4875  IDAT data is put at the start of the in buffer*/
4876  while (!IEND && !state->error) {
4877  unsigned chunkLength;
4878  const unsigned char* data; /*the data in the chunk*/
4879 
4880  /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4881  if ((size_t)((chunk - in) + 12) > insize || chunk < in) {
4882  if (state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/
4883  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 30);
4884  }
4885 
4886  /*length of the data of the chunk, excluding the length bytes, chunk type and CRC bytes*/
4887  chunkLength = lodepng_chunk_length(chunk);
4888  /*error: chunk length larger than the max PNG chunk size*/
4889  if (chunkLength > 2147483647) {
4890  if (state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/
4891  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 63);
4892  }
4893 
4894  if ((size_t)((chunk - in) + chunkLength + 12) > insize || (chunk + chunkLength + 12) < in) {
4895  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 64); /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4896  }
4897 
4898  data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4899 
4900  unknown = 0;
4901 
4902  /*IDAT chunk, containing compressed image data*/
4903  if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IDAT")) {
4904  size_t newsize;
4905  if (lodepng_addofl(idatsize, chunkLength, &newsize)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4906  if (newsize > insize) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4907  lodepng_memcpy(idat + idatsize, data, chunkLength);
4908  idatsize += chunkLength;
4909 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4910  critical_pos = 3;
4911 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4912  }
4913  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IEND")) {
4914  /*IEND chunk*/
4915  IEND = 1;
4916  }
4917  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE")) {
4918  /*palette chunk (PLTE)*/
4919  state->error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4920  if (state->error) break;
4921 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4922  critical_pos = 2;
4923 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4924  }
4925  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tRNS")) {
4926  /*palette transparency chunk (tRNS). Even though this one is an ancillary chunk , it is still compiled
4927  in without 'LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS' because it contains essential color information that
4928  affects the alpha channel of pixels. */
4929  state->error = readChunk_tRNS(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4930  if (state->error) break;
4931 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4932  /*background color chunk (bKGD)*/
4933  }
4934  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "bKGD")) {
4935  state->error = readChunk_bKGD(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4936  if (state->error) break;
4937  }
4938  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tEXt")) {
4939  /*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4940  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4941  state->error = readChunk_tEXt(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4942  if (state->error) break;
4943  }
4944  }
4945  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "zTXt")) {
4946  /*compressed text chunk (zTXt)*/
4947  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4948  state->error = readChunk_zTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4949  if (state->error) break;
4950  }
4951  }
4952  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt")) {
4953  /*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4954  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4955  state->error = readChunk_iTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4956  if (state->error) break;
4957  }
4958  }
4959  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tIME")) {
4960  state->error = readChunk_tIME(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4961  if (state->error) break;
4962  }
4963  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "pHYs")) {
4964  state->error = readChunk_pHYs(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4965  if (state->error) break;
4966  }
4967  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "gAMA")) {
4968  state->error = readChunk_gAMA(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4969  if (state->error) break;
4970  }
4971  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "cHRM")) {
4972  state->error = readChunk_cHRM(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4973  if (state->error) break;
4974  }
4975  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "sRGB")) {
4976  state->error = readChunk_sRGB(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4977  if (state->error) break;
4978  }
4979  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iCCP")) {
4980  state->error = readChunk_iCCP(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4981  if (state->error) break;
4982 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4983  }
4984  else /*it's not an implemented chunk type, so ignore it: skip over the data*/ {
4985  /*error: unknown critical chunk (5th bit of first byte of chunk type is 0)*/
4986  if (!state->decoder.ignore_critical && !lodepng_chunk_ancillary(chunk)) {
4987  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 69);
4988  }
4989 
4990  unknown = 1;
4991 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4992  if (state->decoder.remember_unknown_chunks) {
4993  state->error = lodepng_chunk_append(&state->info_png.unknown_chunks_data[critical_pos - 1],
4994  &state->info_png.unknown_chunks_size[critical_pos - 1], chunk);
4995  if (state->error) break;
4996  }
4997 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4998  }
4999 
5000  if (!state->decoder.ignore_crc && !unknown) /*check CRC if wanted, only on known chunk types*/ {
5001  if (lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
5002  }
5003 
5004  if (!IEND) chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk, in + insize);
5005  }
5006 
5007  if (state->info_png.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE && !state->info_png.color.palette) {
5008  state->error = 106; /* error: PNG file must have PLTE chunk if color type is palette */
5009  }
5010 
5011  if (!state->error) {
5012  /*predict output size, to allocate exact size for output buffer to avoid more dynamic allocation.
5013  If the decompressed size does not match the prediction, the image must be corrupt.*/
5014  if (state->info_png.interlace_method == 0) {
5015  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
5016  expected_size = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(*w, *h, bpp);
5017  }
5018  else {
5019  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
5020  /*Adam-7 interlaced: expected size is the sum of the 7 sub-images sizes*/
5021  expected_size = 0;
5022  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 7) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5023  if (*w > 4) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5024  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 3, bpp);
5025  if (*w > 2) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 2, bpp);
5026  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 2, bpp);
5027  if (*w > 1) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 1, bpp);
5028  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0), (*h + 0) >> 1, bpp);
5029  }
5030 
5031  state->error = zlib_decompress(&scanlines, &scanlines_size, expected_size, idat, idatsize, &state->decoder.zlibsettings);
5032  }
5033  if (!state->error && scanlines_size != expected_size) state->error = 91; /*decompressed size doesn't match prediction*/
5034  lodepng_free(idat);
5035 
5036  if (!state->error) {
5037  outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color);
5038  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
5039  if (!*out) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5040  }
5041  if (!state->error) {
5042  lodepng_memset(*out, 0, outsize);
5043  state->error = postProcessScanlines(*out, scanlines, *w, *h, &state->info_png);
5044  }
5045  lodepng_free(scanlines);
5046 }
5047 
5048 unsigned lodepng_decode(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h,
5049  LodePNGState* state,
5050  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5051  *out = 0;
5052  decodeGeneric(out, w, h, state, in, insize);
5053  if (state->error) return state->error;
5054  if (!state->decoder.color_convert || lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color)) {
5055  /*same color type, no copying or converting of data needed*/
5056  /*store the info_png color settings on the info_raw so that the info_raw still reflects what colortype
5057  the raw image has to the end user*/
5058  if (!state->decoder.color_convert) {
5059  state->error = lodepng_color_mode_copy(&state->info_raw, &state->info_png.color);
5060  if (state->error) return state->error;
5061  }
5062  }
5063  else { /*color conversion needed*/
5064  unsigned char* data = *out;
5065  size_t outsize;
5066 
5067  /*TODO: check if this works according to the statement in the documentation: "The converter can convert
5068  from grayscale input color type, to 8-bit grayscale or grayscale with alpha"*/
5069  if (!(state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGB || state->info_raw.colortype == LCT_RGBA)
5070  && !(state->info_raw.bitdepth == 8)) {
5071  return 56; /*unsupported color mode conversion*/
5072  }
5073 
5074  outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_raw);
5075  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
5076  if (!(*out)) {
5077  state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5078  }
5079  else state->error = lodepng_convert(*out, data, &state->info_raw,
5080  &state->info_png.color, *w, *h);
5081  lodepng_free(data);
5082  }
5083  return state->error;
5084 }
5085 
5086 unsigned lodepng_decode_memory(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in,
5087  size_t insize, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
5088  unsigned error;
5089  LodePNGState state;
5090  lodepng_state_init(&state);
5091  state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
5092  state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
5093  error = lodepng_decode(out, w, h, &state, in, insize);
5094  lodepng_state_cleanup(&state);
5095  return error;
5096 }
5097 
5098 unsigned lodepng_decode32(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5099  return lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, in, insize, LCT_RGBA, 8);
5100 }
5101 
5102 unsigned lodepng_decode24(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
5103  return lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, in, insize, LCT_RGB, 8);
5104 }
5105 
5106 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
5107 unsigned lodepng_decode_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename,
5108  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
5109  unsigned char* buffer = 0;
5110  size_t buffersize;
5111  unsigned error;
5112  /* safe output values in case error happens */
5113  *out = 0;
5114  *w = *h = 0;
5115  error = lodepng_load_file(&buffer, &buffersize, filename);
5116  if (!error) error = lodepng_decode_memory(out, w, h, buffer, buffersize, colortype, bitdepth);
5117  lodepng_free(buffer);
5118  return error;
5119 }
5120 
5121 unsigned lodepng_decode32_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename) {
5122  return lodepng_decode_file(out, w, h, filename, LCT_RGBA, 8);
5123 }
5124 
5125 unsigned lodepng_decode24_file(unsigned char** out, unsigned* w, unsigned* h, const char* filename) {
5126  return lodepng_decode_file(out, w, h, filename, LCT_RGB, 8);
5127 }
5128 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK*/
5129 
5130 void lodepng_decoder_settings_init(LodePNGDecoderSettings* settings) {
5131  settings->color_convert = 1;
5132 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5133  settings->read_text_chunks = 1;
5134  settings->remember_unknown_chunks = 0;
5135 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5136  settings->ignore_crc = 0;
5137  settings->ignore_critical = 0;
5138  settings->ignore_end = 0;
5139  lodepng_decompress_settings_init(&settings->zlibsettings);
5140 }
5141 
5142 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
5143 
5144 #if defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER) || defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER)
5145 
5146 void lodepng_state_init(LodePNGState* state) {
5147 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
5148  lodepng_decoder_settings_init(&state->decoder);
5149 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER*/
5150 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
5151  lodepng_encoder_settings_init(&state->encoder);
5152 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
5153  lodepng_color_mode_init(&state->info_raw);
5154  lodepng_info_init(&state->info_png);
5155  state->error = 1;
5156 }
5157 
5158 void lodepng_state_cleanup(LodePNGState* state) {
5159  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(&state->info_raw);
5160  lodepng_info_cleanup(&state->info_png);
5161 }
5162 
5163 void lodepng_state_copy(LodePNGState* dest, const LodePNGState* source) {
5164  lodepng_state_cleanup(dest);
5165  *dest = *source;
5166  lodepng_color_mode_init(&dest->info_raw);
5167  lodepng_info_init(&dest->info_png);
5168  dest->error = lodepng_color_mode_copy(&dest->info_raw, &source->info_raw); if (dest->error) return;
5169  dest->error = lodepng_info_copy(&dest->info_png, &source->info_png); if (dest->error) return;
5170 }
5171 
5172 #endif /* defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER) || defined(LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER) */
5173 
5174 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
5175 
5176 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
5177 /* / PNG Encoder / */
5178 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
5179 
5180 
5181 static unsigned writeSignature(ucvector* out) {
5182  size_t pos = out->size;
5183  const unsigned char signature[] = { 137, 80, 78, 71, 13, 10, 26, 10 };
5184  /*8 bytes PNG signature, aka the magic bytes*/
5185  if (!ucvector_resize(out, out->size + 8)) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
5186  lodepng_memcpy(out->data + pos, signature, 8);
5187  return 0;
5188 }
5189 
5190 static unsigned addChunk_IHDR(ucvector* out, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5191  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth, unsigned interlace_method) {
5192  unsigned char* chunk, * data;
5193  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 13, "IHDR"));
5194  data = chunk + 8;
5195 
5196  lodepng_set32bitInt(data + 0, w); /*width*/
5197  lodepng_set32bitInt(data + 4, h); /*height*/
5198  data[8] = (unsigned char)bitdepth; /*bit depth*/
5199  data[9] = (unsigned char)colortype; /*color type*/
5200  data[10] = 0; /*compression method*/
5201  data[11] = 0; /*filter method*/
5202  data[12] = interlace_method; /*interlace method*/
5203 
5204  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5205  return 0;
5206 }
5207 
5208 /* only adds the chunk if needed (there is a key or palette with alpha) */
5209 static unsigned addChunk_PLTE(ucvector* out, const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
5210  unsigned char* chunk;
5211  size_t i, j = 8;
5212 
5213  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, info->palettesize * 3, "PLTE"));
5214 
5215  for (i = 0; i != info->palettesize; ++i) {
5216  /*add all channels except alpha channel*/
5217  chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 0];
5218  chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 1];
5219  chunk[j++] = info->palette[i * 4 + 2];
5220  }
5221 
5222  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5223  return 0;
5224 }
5225 
5226 static unsigned addChunk_tRNS(ucvector* out, const LodePNGColorMode* info) {
5227  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5228 
5229  if (info->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
5230  size_t i, amount = info->palettesize;
5231  /*the tail of palette values that all have 255 as alpha, does not have to be encoded*/
5232  for (i = info->palettesize; i != 0; --i) {
5233  if (info->palette[4 * (i - 1) + 3] != 255) break;
5234  --amount;
5235  }
5236  if (amount) {
5237  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, amount, "tRNS"));
5238  /*add the alpha channel values from the palette*/
5239  for (i = 0; i != amount; ++i) chunk[8 + i] = info->palette[4 * i + 3];
5240  }
5241  }
5242  else if (info->colortype == LCT_GREY) {
5243  if (info->key_defined) {
5244  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 2, "tRNS"));
5245  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8);
5246  chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255);
5247  }
5248  }
5249  else if (info->colortype == LCT_RGB) {
5250  if (info->key_defined) {
5251  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 6, "tRNS"));
5252  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r >> 8);
5253  chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->key_r & 255);
5254  chunk[10] = (unsigned char)(info->key_g >> 8);
5255  chunk[11] = (unsigned char)(info->key_g & 255);
5256  chunk[12] = (unsigned char)(info->key_b >> 8);
5257  chunk[13] = (unsigned char)(info->key_b & 255);
5258  }
5259  }
5260 
5261  if (chunk) lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5262  return 0;
5263 }
5264 
5265 static unsigned addChunk_IDAT(ucvector* out, const unsigned char* data, size_t datasize,
5266  LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5267  unsigned error = 0;
5268  unsigned char* zlib = 0;
5269  size_t zlibsize = 0;
5270 
5271  error = zlib_compress(&zlib, &zlibsize, data, datasize, zlibsettings);
5272  if (!error) {
5273  error = lodepng_chunk_createv(out, zlibsize, "IDAT", zlib);
5274  }
5275  lodepng_free(zlib);
5276  return error;
5277 }
5278 
5279 static unsigned addChunk_IEND(ucvector* out) {
5280  return lodepng_chunk_createv(out, 0, "IEND", 0);
5281 }
5282 
5283 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5284 
5285 static unsigned addChunk_tEXt(ucvector* out, const char* keyword, const char* textstring) {
5286  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5287  size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword), textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5288  size_t size = keysize + 1 + textsize;
5289  if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5290  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "tEXt"));
5291  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, keyword, keysize);
5292  chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5293  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 9 + keysize, textstring, textsize);
5294  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5295  return 0;
5296 }
5297 
5298 static unsigned addChunk_zTXt(ucvector* out, const char* keyword, const char* textstring,
5299  LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5300  unsigned error = 0;
5301  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5302  unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5303  size_t compressedsize = 0;
5304  size_t textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5305  size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword);
5306  if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5307 
5308  error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5309  (const unsigned char*)textstring, textsize, zlibsettings);
5310  if (!error) {
5311  size_t size = keysize + 2 + compressedsize;
5312  error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "zTXt");
5313  }
5314  if (!error) {
5315  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, keyword, keysize);
5316  chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5317  chunk[9 + keysize] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5318  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 10 + keysize, compressed, compressedsize);
5319  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5320  }
5321 
5322  lodepng_free(compressed);
5323  return error;
5324 }
5325 
5326 static unsigned addChunk_iTXt(ucvector* out, unsigned compress, const char* keyword, const char* langtag,
5327  const char* transkey, const char* textstring, LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5328  unsigned error = 0;
5329  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5330  unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5331  size_t compressedsize = 0;
5332  size_t textsize = lodepng_strlen(textstring);
5333  size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(keyword), langsize = lodepng_strlen(langtag), transsize = lodepng_strlen(transkey);
5334 
5335  if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5336 
5337  if (compress) {
5338  error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5339  (const unsigned char*)textstring, textsize, zlibsettings);
5340  }
5341  if (!error) {
5342  size_t size = keysize + 3 + langsize + 1 + transsize + 1 + (compress ? compressedsize : textsize);
5343  error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "iTXt");
5344  }
5345  if (!error) {
5346  size_t pos = 8;
5347  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, keyword, keysize);
5348  pos += keysize;
5349  chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5350  chunk[pos++] = (compress ? 1 : 0); /*compression flag*/
5351  chunk[pos++] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5352  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, langtag, langsize);
5353  pos += langsize;
5354  chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5355  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, transkey, transsize);
5356  pos += transsize;
5357  chunk[pos++] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5358  if (compress) {
5359  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, compressed, compressedsize);
5360  }
5361  else {
5362  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + pos, textstring, textsize);
5363  }
5364  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5365  }
5366 
5367  lodepng_free(compressed);
5368  return error;
5369 }
5370 
5371 static unsigned addChunk_bKGD(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5372  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5373  if (info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info->color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
5374  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 2, "bKGD"));
5375  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r >> 8);
5376  chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255);
5377  }
5378  else if (info->color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info->color.colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
5379  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 6, "bKGD"));
5380  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r >> 8);
5381  chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255);
5382  chunk[10] = (unsigned char)(info->background_g >> 8);
5383  chunk[11] = (unsigned char)(info->background_g & 255);
5384  chunk[12] = (unsigned char)(info->background_b >> 8);
5385  chunk[13] = (unsigned char)(info->background_b & 255);
5386  }
5387  else if (info->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
5388  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 1, "bKGD"));
5389  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(info->background_r & 255); /*palette index*/
5390  }
5391  if (chunk) lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5392  return 0;
5393 }
5394 
5395 static unsigned addChunk_tIME(ucvector* out, const LodePNGTime* time) {
5396  unsigned char* chunk;
5397  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 7, "tIME"));
5398  chunk[8] = (unsigned char)(time->year >> 8);
5399  chunk[9] = (unsigned char)(time->year & 255);
5400  chunk[10] = (unsigned char)time->month;
5401  chunk[11] = (unsigned char)time->day;
5402  chunk[12] = (unsigned char)time->hour;
5403  chunk[13] = (unsigned char)time->minute;
5404  chunk[14] = (unsigned char)time->second;
5405  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5406  return 0;
5407 }
5408 
5409 static unsigned addChunk_pHYs(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5410  unsigned char* chunk;
5411  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 9, "pHYs"));
5412  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->phys_x);
5413  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 12, info->phys_y);
5414  chunk[16] = info->phys_unit;
5415  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5416  return 0;
5417 }
5418 
5419 static unsigned addChunk_gAMA(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5420  unsigned char* chunk;
5421  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 4, "gAMA"));
5422  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->gama_gamma);
5423  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5424  return 0;
5425 }
5426 
5427 static unsigned addChunk_cHRM(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5428  unsigned char* chunk;
5429  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, 32, "cHRM"));
5430  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 8, info->chrm_white_x);
5431  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 12, info->chrm_white_y);
5432  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 16, info->chrm_red_x);
5433  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 20, info->chrm_red_y);
5434  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 24, info->chrm_green_x);
5435  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 28, info->chrm_green_y);
5436  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 32, info->chrm_blue_x);
5437  lodepng_set32bitInt(chunk + 36, info->chrm_blue_y);
5438  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5439  return 0;
5440 }
5441 
5442 static unsigned addChunk_sRGB(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info) {
5443  unsigned char data = info->srgb_intent;
5444  return lodepng_chunk_createv(out, 1, "sRGB", &data);
5445 }
5446 
5447 static unsigned addChunk_iCCP(ucvector* out, const LodePNGInfo* info, LodePNGCompressSettings* zlibsettings) {
5448  unsigned error = 0;
5449  unsigned char* chunk = 0;
5450  unsigned char* compressed = 0;
5451  size_t compressedsize = 0;
5452  size_t keysize = lodepng_strlen(info->iccp_name);
5453 
5454  if (keysize < 1 || keysize > 79) return 89; /*error: invalid keyword size*/
5455  error = zlib_compress(&compressed, &compressedsize,
5456  info->iccp_profile, info->iccp_profile_size, zlibsettings);
5457  if (!error) {
5458  size_t size = keysize + 2 + compressedsize;
5459  error = lodepng_chunk_init(&chunk, out, size, "iCCP");
5460  }
5461  if (!error) {
5462  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 8, info->iccp_name, keysize);
5463  chunk[8 + keysize] = 0; /*null termination char*/
5464  chunk[9 + keysize] = 0; /*compression method: 0*/
5465  lodepng_memcpy(chunk + 10 + keysize, compressed, compressedsize);
5466  lodepng_chunk_generate_crc(chunk);
5467  }
5468 
5469  lodepng_free(compressed);
5470  return error;
5471 }
5472 
5473 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5474 
5475 static void filterScanline(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* scanline, const unsigned char* prevline,
5476  size_t length, size_t bytewidth, unsigned char filterType) {
5477  size_t i;
5478  switch (filterType) {
5479  case 0: /*None*/
5480  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5481  break;
5482  case 1: /*Sub*/
5483  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5484  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth];
5485  break;
5486  case 2: /*Up*/
5487  if (prevline) {
5488  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - prevline[i];
5489  }
5490  else {
5491  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5492  }
5493  break;
5494  case 3: /*Average*/
5495  if (prevline) {
5496  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (prevline[i] >> 1);
5497  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - ((scanline[i - bytewidth] + prevline[i]) >> 1);
5498  }
5499  else {
5500  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5501  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (scanline[i - bytewidth] >> 1);
5502  }
5503  break;
5504  case 4: /*Paeth*/
5505  if (prevline) {
5506  /*paethPredictor(0, prevline[i], 0) is always prevline[i]*/
5507  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - prevline[i]);
5508  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) {
5509  out[i] = (scanline[i] - paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], prevline[i], prevline[i - bytewidth]));
5510  }
5511  }
5512  else {
5513  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5514  /*paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always scanline[i - bytewidth]*/
5515  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth]);
5516  }
5517  break;
5518  default: return; /*invalid filter type given*/
5519  }
5520 }
5521 
5522 /* integer binary logarithm, max return value is 31 */
5523 static size_t ilog2(size_t i) {
5524  size_t result = 0;
5525  if (i >= 65536) { result += 16; i >>= 16; }
5526  if (i >= 256) { result += 8; i >>= 8; }
5527  if (i >= 16) { result += 4; i >>= 4; }
5528  if (i >= 4) { result += 2; i >>= 2; }
5529  if (i >= 2) { result += 1; /*i >>= 1;*/ }
5530  return result;
5531 }
5532 
5533 /* integer approximation for i * log2(i), helper function for LFS_ENTROPY */
5534 static size_t ilog2i(size_t i) {
5535  size_t l;
5536  if (i == 0) return 0;
5537  l = ilog2(i);
5538  /* approximate i*log2(i): l is integer logarithm, ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u)
5539  linearly approximates the missing fractional part multiplied by i */
5540  return i * l + ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u);
5541 }
5542 
5543 static unsigned filter(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5544  const LodePNGColorMode* color, const LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
5545  /*
5546  For PNG filter method 0
5547  out must be a buffer with as size: h + (w * h * bpp + 7u) / 8u, because there are
5548  the scanlines with 1 extra byte per scanline
5549  */
5550 
5551  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(color);
5552  /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
5553  size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
5554 
5555  /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
5556  size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
5557  const unsigned char* prevline = 0;
5558  unsigned x, y;
5559  unsigned error = 0;
5560  LodePNGFilterStrategy strategy = settings->filter_strategy;
5561 
5562  /*
5563  There is a heuristic called the minimum sum of absolute differences heuristic, suggested by the PNG standard:
5564  * If the image type is Palette, or the bit depth is smaller than 8, then do not filter the image (i.e.
5565  use fixed filtering, with the filter None).
5566  * (The other case) If the image type is Grayscale or RGB (with or without Alpha), and the bit depth is
5567  not smaller than 8, then use adaptive filtering heuristic as follows: independently for each row, apply
5568  all five filters and select the filter that produces the smallest sum of absolute values per row.
5569  This heuristic is used if filter strategy is LFS_MINSUM and filter_palette_zero is true.
5570 
5571  If filter_palette_zero is true and filter_strategy is not LFS_MINSUM, the above heuristic is followed,
5572  but for "the other case", whatever strategy filter_strategy is set to instead of the minimum sum
5573  heuristic is used.
5574  */
5575  if (settings->filter_palette_zero &&
5576  (color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE || color->bitdepth < 8)) strategy = LFS_ZERO;
5577 
5578  if (bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid color type*/
5579 
5580  if (strategy >= LFS_ZERO && strategy <= LFS_FOUR) {
5581  unsigned char type = (unsigned char)strategy;
5582  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5583  size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5584  size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5585  out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5586  filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5587  prevline = &in[inindex];
5588  }
5589  }
5590  else if (strategy == LFS_MINSUM) {
5591  /*adaptive filtering*/
5592  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5593  size_t smallest = 0;
5594  unsigned char type, bestType = 0;
5595 
5596  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5597  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5598  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5599  }
5600 
5601  if (!error) {
5602  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5603  /*try the 5 filter types*/
5604  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5605  size_t sum = 0;
5606  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5607 
5608  /*calculate the sum of the result*/
5609  if (type == 0) {
5610  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) sum += (unsigned char)(attempt[type][x]);
5611  }
5612  else {
5613  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) {
5614  /*For differences, each byte should be treated as signed, values above 127 are negative
5615  (converted to signed char). Filtertype 0 isn't a difference though, so use unsigned there.
5616  This means filtertype 0 is almost never chosen, but that is justified.*/
5617  unsigned char s = attempt[type][x];
5618  sum += s < 128 ? s : (255U - s);
5619  }
5620  }
5621 
5622  /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5623  if (type == 0 || sum < smallest) {
5624  bestType = type;
5625  smallest = sum;
5626  }
5627  }
5628 
5629  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5630 
5631  /*now fill the out values*/
5632  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5633  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5634  }
5635  }
5636 
5637  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5638  }
5639  else if (strategy == LFS_ENTROPY) {
5640  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5641  size_t bestSum = 0;
5642  unsigned type, bestType = 0;
5643  unsigned count[256];
5644 
5645  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5646  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5647  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5648  }
5649 
5650  if (!error) {
5651  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5652  /*try the 5 filter types*/
5653  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5654  size_t sum = 0;
5655  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5656  lodepng_memset(count, 0, 256 * sizeof(*count));
5657  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) ++count[attempt[type][x]];
5658  ++count[type]; /*the filter type itself is part of the scanline*/
5659  for (x = 0; x != 256; ++x) {
5660  sum += ilog2i(count[x]);
5661  }
5662  /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5663  if (type == 0 || sum > bestSum) {
5664  bestType = type;
5665  bestSum = sum;
5666  }
5667  }
5668 
5669  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5670 
5671  /*now fill the out values*/
5672  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5673  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5674  }
5675  }
5676 
5677  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5678  }
5679  else if (strategy == LFS_PREDEFINED) {
5680  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5681  size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5682  size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5683  unsigned char type = settings->predefined_filters[y];
5684  out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5685  filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5686  prevline = &in[inindex];
5687  }
5688  }
5689  else if (strategy == LFS_BRUTE_FORCE) {
5690  /*brute force filter chooser.
5691  deflate the scanline after every filter attempt to see which one deflates best.
5692  This is very slow and gives only slightly smaller, sometimes even larger, result*/
5693  size_t size[5];
5694  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5695  size_t smallest = 0;
5696  unsigned type = 0, bestType = 0;
5697  unsigned char* dummy;
5698  LodePNGCompressSettings zlibsettings;
5699  lodepng_memcpy(&zlibsettings, &settings->zlibsettings, sizeof(LodePNGCompressSettings));
5700  /*use fixed tree on the attempts so that the tree is not adapted to the filtertype on purpose,
5701  to simulate the true case where the tree is the same for the whole image. Sometimes it gives
5702  better result with dynamic tree anyway. Using the fixed tree sometimes gives worse, but in rare
5703  cases better compression. It does make this a bit less slow, so it's worth doing this.*/
5704  zlibsettings.btype = 1;
5705  /*a custom encoder likely doesn't read the btype setting and is optimized for complete PNG
5706  images only, so disable it*/
5707  zlibsettings.custom_zlib = 0;
5708  zlibsettings.custom_deflate = 0;
5709  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5710  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5711  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5712  }
5713  if (!error) {
5714  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) /*try the 5 filter types*/ {
5715  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5716  unsigned testsize = (unsigned)linebytes;
5717  /*if(testsize > 8) testsize /= 8;*/ /*it already works good enough by testing a part of the row*/
5718 
5719  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5720  size[type] = 0;
5721  dummy = 0;
5722  zlib_compress(&dummy, &size[type], attempt[type], testsize, &zlibsettings);
5723  lodepng_free(dummy);
5724  /*check if this is smallest size (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5725  if (type == 0 || size[type] < smallest) {
5726  bestType = type;
5727  smallest = size[type];
5728  }
5729  }
5730  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5731  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5732  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5733  }
5734  }
5735  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5736  }
5737  else return 88; /* unknown filter strategy */
5738 
5739  return error;
5740 }
5741 
5742 static void addPaddingBits(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in,
5743  size_t olinebits, size_t ilinebits, unsigned h) {
5744  /*The opposite of the removePaddingBits function
5745  olinebits must be >= ilinebits*/
5746  unsigned y;
5747  size_t diff = olinebits - ilinebits;
5748  size_t obp = 0, ibp = 0; /*bit pointers*/
5749  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5750  size_t x;
5751  for (x = 0; x < ilinebits; ++x) {
5752  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
5753  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
5754  }
5755  /*obp += diff; --> no, fill in some value in the padding bits too, to avoid
5756  "Use of uninitialised value of size ###" warning from valgrind*/
5757  for (x = 0; x != diff; ++x) setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, 0);
5758  }
5759 }
5760 
5761 /*
5762 in: non-interlaced image with size w*h
5763 out: the same pixels, but re-ordered according to PNG's Adam7 interlacing, with
5764  no padding bits between scanlines, but between reduced images so that each
5765  reduced image starts at a byte.
5766 bpp: bits per pixel
5767 there are no padding bits, not between scanlines, not between reduced images
5768 in has the following size in bits: w * h * bpp.
5769 out is possibly bigger due to padding bits between reduced images
5770 NOTE: comments about padding bits are only relevant if bpp < 8
5771 */
5772 static void Adam7_interlace(unsigned char* out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h, unsigned bpp) {
5773  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
5774  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
5775  unsigned i;
5776 
5777  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
5778 
5779  if (bpp >= 8) {
5780  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5781  unsigned x, y, b;
5782  size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8u;
5783  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
5784  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
5785  size_t pixelinstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * w + ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
5786  size_t pixeloutstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
5787  for (b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b) {
5788  out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
5789  }
5790  }
5791  }
5792  }
5793  else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/ {
5794  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5795  unsigned x, y, b;
5796  unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
5797  unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
5798  size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
5799  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
5800  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
5801  ibp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
5802  obp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
5803  for (b = 0; b < bpp; ++b) {
5804  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
5805  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
5806  }
5807  }
5808  }
5809  }
5810 }
5811 
5812 /*out must be buffer big enough to contain uncompressed IDAT chunk data, and in must contain the full image.
5813 return value is error**/
5814 static unsigned preProcessScanlines(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* in,
5815  unsigned w, unsigned h,
5816  const LodePNGInfo* info_png, const LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
5817  /*
5818  This function converts the pure 2D image with the PNG's colortype, into filtered-padded-interlaced data. Steps:
5819  *) if no Adam7: 1) add padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8) 2) filter
5820  *) if adam7: 1) Adam7_interlace 2) 7x add padding bits 3) 7x filter
5821  */
5822  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
5823  unsigned error = 0;
5824 
5825  if (info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
5826  *outsize = h + (h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u)); /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
