5827  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5828  if (!(*out) && (*outsize)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5829 
5830  if (!error) {
5831  /*non multiple of 8 bits per scanline, padding bits needed per scanline*/
5832  if (bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
5833  unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u));
5834  if (!padded) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5835  if (!error) {
5836  addPaddingBits(padded, in, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, w * bpp, h);
5837  error = filter(*out, padded, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5838  }
5839  lodepng_free(padded);
5840  }
5841  else {
5842  /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
5843  error = filter(*out, in, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5844  }
5845  }
5846  }
5847  else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
5848  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
5849  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
5850  unsigned char* adam7;
5851 
5852  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
5853 
5854  *outsize = filter_passstart[7]; /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
5855  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5856  if (!(*out)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5857 
5858  adam7 = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(passstart[7]);
5859  if (!adam7 && passstart[7]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5860 
5861  if (!error) {
5862  unsigned i;
5863 
5864  Adam7_interlace(adam7, in, w, h, bpp);
5865  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5866  if (bpp < 8) {
5867  unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(padded_passstart[i + 1] - padded_passstart[i]);
5868  if (!padded) ERROR_BREAK(83); /*alloc fail*/
5869  addPaddingBits(padded, &adam7[passstart[i]],
5870  ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passw[i] * bpp, passh[i]);
5871  error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], padded,
5872  passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5873  lodepng_free(padded);
5874  }
5875  else {
5876  error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], &adam7[padded_passstart[i]],
5877  passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5878  }
5879 
5880  if (error) break;
5881  }
5882  }
5883 
5884  lodepng_free(adam7);
5885  }
5886 
5887  return error;
5888 }
5889 
5890 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5891 static unsigned addUnknownChunks(ucvector* out, unsigned char* data, size_t datasize) {
5892  unsigned char* inchunk = data;
5893  while ((size_t)(inchunk - data) < datasize) {
5894  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(lodepng_chunk_append(&out->data, &out->size, inchunk));
5895  out->allocsize = out->size; /*fix the allocsize again*/
5896  inchunk = lodepng_chunk_next(inchunk, data + datasize);
5897  }
5898  return 0;
5899 }
5900 
5901 static unsigned isGrayICCProfile(const unsigned char* profile, unsigned size) {
5902  /*
5903  It is a gray profile if bytes 16-19 are "GRAY", rgb profile if bytes 16-19
5904  are "RGB ". We do not perform any full parsing of the ICC profile here, other
5905  than check those 4 bytes to grayscale profile. Other than that, validity of
5906  the profile is not checked. This is needed only because the PNG specification
5907  requires using a non-gray color model if there is an ICC profile with "RGB "
5908  (sadly limiting compression opportunities if the input data is grayscale RGB
5909  data), and requires using a gray color model if it is "GRAY".
5910  */
5911  if (size < 20) return 0;
5912  return profile[16] == 'G' && profile[17] == 'R' && profile[18] == 'A' && profile[19] == 'Y';
5913 }
5914 
5915 static unsigned isRGBICCProfile(const unsigned char* profile, unsigned size) {
5916  /* See comment in isGrayICCProfile*/
5917  if (size < 20) return 0;
5918  return profile[16] == 'R' && profile[17] == 'G' && profile[18] == 'B' && profile[19] == ' ';
5919 }
5920 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
5921 
5922 unsigned lodepng_encode(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize,
5923  const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h,
5924  LodePNGState* state) {
5925  unsigned char* data = 0; /*uncompressed version of the IDAT chunk data*/
5926  size_t datasize = 0;
5927  ucvector outv = ucvector_init(NULL, 0);
5928  LodePNGInfo info;
5929  const LodePNGInfo* info_png = &state->info_png;
5930 
5931  lodepng_info_init(&info);
5932 
5933  /*provide some proper output values if error will happen*/
5934  *out = 0;
5935  *outsize = 0;
5936  state->error = 0;
5937 
5938  /*check input values validity*/
5939  if ((info_png->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE || state->encoder.force_palette)
5940  && (info_png->color.palettesize == 0 || info_png->color.palettesize > 256)) {
5941  state->error = 68; /*invalid palette size, it is only allowed to be 1-256*/
5942  goto cleanup;
5943  }
5944  if (state->encoder.zlibsettings.btype > 2) {
5945  state->error = 61; /*error: invalid btype*/
5946  goto cleanup;
5947  }
5948  if (info_png->interlace_method > 1) {
5949  state->error = 71; /*error: invalid interlace mode*/
5950  goto cleanup;
5951  }
5952  state->error = checkColorValidity(info_png->color.colortype, info_png->color.bitdepth);
5953  if (state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5954  state->error = checkColorValidity(state->info_raw.colortype, state->info_raw.bitdepth);
5955  if (state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5956 
5957  /* color convert and compute scanline filter types */
5958  lodepng_info_copy(&info, &state->info_png);
5959  if (state->encoder.auto_convert) {
5960  LodePNGColorStats stats;
5961  lodepng_color_stats_init(&stats);
5962 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5963  if (info_png->iccp_defined &&
5964  isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5965  /*the PNG specification does not allow to use palette with a GRAY ICC profile, even
5966  if the palette has only gray colors, so disallow it.*/
5967  stats.allow_palette = 0;
5968  }
5969  if (info_png->iccp_defined &&
5970  isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5971  /*the PNG specification does not allow to use grayscale color with RGB ICC profile, so disallow gray.*/
5972  stats.allow_greyscale = 0;
5973  }
5974 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5975  state->error = lodepng_compute_color_stats(&stats, image, w, h, &state->info_raw);
5976  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5977 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5978  if (info_png->background_defined) {
5979  /*the background chunk's color must be taken into account as well*/
5980  unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
5981  LodePNGColorMode mode16 = lodepng_color_mode_make(LCT_RGB, 16);
5982  lodepng_convert_rgb(&r, &g, &b, info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &mode16, &info_png->color);
5983  state->error = lodepng_color_stats_add(&stats, r, g, b, 65535);
5984  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5985  }
5986 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5987  state->error = auto_choose_color(&info.color, &state->info_raw, &stats);
5988  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5989 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5990  /*also convert the background chunk*/
5991  if (info_png->background_defined) {
5992  if (lodepng_convert_rgb(&info.background_r, &info.background_g, &info.background_b,
5993  info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &info.color, &info_png->color)) {
5994  state->error = 104;
5995  goto cleanup;
5996  }
5997  }
5998 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5999  }
6000 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6001  if (info_png->iccp_defined) {
6002  unsigned gray_icc = isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6003  unsigned rgb_icc = isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6004  unsigned gray_png = info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA;
6005  if (!gray_icc && !rgb_icc) {
6006  state->error = 100; /* Disallowed profile color type for PNG */
6007  goto cleanup;
6008  }
6009  if (gray_icc != gray_png) {
6010  /*Not allowed to use RGB/RGBA/palette with GRAY ICC profile or vice versa,
6011  or in case of auto_convert, it wasn't possible to find appropriate model*/
6012  state->error = state->encoder.auto_convert ? 102 : 101;
6013  goto cleanup;
6014  }
6015  }
6016 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6017  if (!lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &info.color)) {
6018  unsigned char* converted;
6019  size_t size = ((size_t)w * (size_t)h * (size_t)lodepng_get_bpp(&info.color) + 7u) / 8u;
6020 
6021  converted = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(size);
6022  if (!converted && size) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
6023  if (!state->error) {
6024  state->error = lodepng_convert(converted, image, &info.color, &state->info_raw, w, h);
6025  }
6026  if (!state->error) {
6027  state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, converted, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6028  }
6029  lodepng_free(converted);
6030  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6031  }
6032  else {
6033  state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, image, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6034  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6035  }
6036 
6037  /* output all PNG chunks */ {
6038 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6039  size_t i;
6040 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6041  /*write signature and chunks*/
6042  state->error = writeSignature(&outv);
6043  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6044  /*IHDR*/
6045  state->error = addChunk_IHDR(&outv, w, h, info.color.colortype, info.color.bitdepth, info.interlace_method);
6046  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6047 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6048  /*unknown chunks between IHDR and PLTE*/
6049  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[0]) {
6050  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[0], info.unknown_chunks_size[0]);
6051  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6052  }
6053  /*color profile chunks must come before PLTE */
6054  if (info.iccp_defined) {
6055  state->error = addChunk_iCCP(&outv, &info, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6056  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6057  }
6058  if (info.srgb_defined) {
6059  state->error = addChunk_sRGB(&outv, &info);
6060  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6061  }
6062  if (info.gama_defined) {
6063  state->error = addChunk_gAMA(&outv, &info);
6064  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6065  }
6066  if (info.chrm_defined) {
6067  state->error = addChunk_cHRM(&outv, &info);
6068  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6069  }
6070 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6071  /*PLTE*/
6072  if (info.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
6073  state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6074  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6075  }
6076  if (state->encoder.force_palette && (info.color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info.color.colortype == LCT_RGBA)) {
6077  /*force_palette means: write suggested palette for truecolor in PLTE chunk*/
6078  state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6079  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6080  }
6081  /*tRNS (this will only add if when necessary) */
6082  state->error = addChunk_tRNS(&outv, &info.color);
6083  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6084 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6085  /*bKGD (must come between PLTE and the IDAt chunks*/
6086  if (info.background_defined) {
6087  state->error = addChunk_bKGD(&outv, &info);
6088  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6089  }
6090  /*pHYs (must come before the IDAT chunks)*/
6091  if (info.phys_defined) {
6092  state->error = addChunk_pHYs(&outv, &info);
6093  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6094  }
6095 
6096  /*unknown chunks between PLTE and IDAT*/
6097  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[1]) {
6098  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[1], info.unknown_chunks_size[1]);
6099  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6100  }
6101 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6102  /*IDAT (multiple IDAT chunks must be consecutive)*/
6103  state->error = addChunk_IDAT(&outv, data, datasize, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6104  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6105 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6106  /*tIME*/
6107  if (info.time_defined) {
6108  state->error = addChunk_tIME(&outv, &info.time);
6109  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6110  }
6111  /*tEXt and/or zTXt*/
6112  for (i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6113  if (lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) > 79) {
6114  state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6115  goto cleanup;
6116  }
6117  if (lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) < 1) {
6118  state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6119  goto cleanup;
6120  }
6121  if (state->encoder.text_compression) {
6122  state->error = addChunk_zTXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i], &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6123  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6124  }
6125  else {
6126  state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i]);
6127  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6128  }
6129  }
6130  /*LodePNG version id in text chunk*/
6131  if (state->encoder.add_id) {
6132  unsigned already_added_id_text = 0;
6133  for (i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6134  const char* k = info.text_keys[i];
6135  /* Could use strcmp, but we're not calling or reimplementing this C library function for this use only */
6136  if (k[0] == 'L' && k[1] == 'o' && k[2] == 'd' && k[3] == 'e' &&
6137  k[4] == 'P' && k[5] == 'N' && k[6] == 'G' && k[7] == '\0') {
6138  already_added_id_text = 1;
6139  break;
6140  }
6141  }
6142  if (already_added_id_text == 0) {
6143  state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, "LodePNG", LODEPNG_VERSION_STRING); /*it's shorter as tEXt than as zTXt chunk*/
6144  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6145  }
6146  }
6147  /*iTXt*/
6148  for (i = 0; i != info.itext_num; ++i) {
6149  if (lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) > 79) {
6150  state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6151  goto cleanup;
6152  }
6153  if (lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) < 1) {
6154  state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6155  goto cleanup;
6156  }
6157  state->error = addChunk_iTXt(
6158  &outv, state->encoder.text_compression,
6159  info.itext_keys[i], info.itext_langtags[i], info.itext_transkeys[i], info.itext_strings[i],
6160  &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6161  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6162  }
6163 
6164  /*unknown chunks between IDAT and IEND*/
6165  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[2]) {
6166  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[2], info.unknown_chunks_size[2]);
6167  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6168  }
6169 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6170  state->error = addChunk_IEND(&outv);
6171  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6172  }
6173 
6174 cleanup:
6175  lodepng_info_cleanup(&info);
6176  lodepng_free(data);
6177 
6178  /*instead of cleaning the vector up, give it to the output*/
6179  *out = outv.data;
6180  *outsize = outv.size;
6181 
6182  return state->error;
6183 }
6184 
6185 unsigned lodepng_encode_memory(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image,
6186  unsigned w, unsigned h, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6187  unsigned error;
6188  LodePNGState state;
6189  lodepng_state_init(&state);
6190  state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
6191  state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6192  state.info_png.color.colortype = colortype;
6193  state.info_png.color.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6194  lodepng_encode(out, outsize, image, w, h, &state);
6195  error = state.error;
6196  lodepng_state_cleanup(&state);
6197  return error;
6198 }
6199 
6200 unsigned lodepng_encode32(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6201  return lodepng_encode_memory(out, outsize, image, w, h, LCT_RGBA, 8);
6202 }
6203 
6204 unsigned lodepng_encode24(unsigned char** out, size_t* outsize, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6205  return lodepng_encode_memory(out, outsize, image, w, h, LCT_RGB, 8);
6206 }
6207 
6208 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6209 unsigned lodepng_encode_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6210  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6211  unsigned char* buffer;
6212  size_t buffersize;
6213  unsigned error = lodepng_encode_memory(&buffer, &buffersize, image, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6214  if (!error) error = lodepng_save_file(buffer, buffersize, filename);
6215  lodepng_free(buffer);
6216  return error;
6217 }
6218 
6219 unsigned lodepng_encode32_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6220  return lodepng_encode_file(filename, image, w, h, LCT_RGBA, 8);
6221 }
6222 
6223 unsigned lodepng_encode24_file(const char* filename, const unsigned char* image, unsigned w, unsigned h) {
6224  return lodepng_encode_file(filename, image, w, h, LCT_RGB, 8);
6225 }
6226 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK*/
6227 
6228 void lodepng_encoder_settings_init(LodePNGEncoderSettings* settings) {
6229  lodepng_compress_settings_init(&settings->zlibsettings);
6230  settings->filter_palette_zero = 1;
6231  settings->filter_strategy = LFS_MINSUM;
6232  settings->auto_convert = 1;
6233  settings->force_palette = 0;
6234  settings->predefined_filters = 0;
6235 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6236  settings->add_id = 0;
6237  settings->text_compression = 1;
6238 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6239 }
6240 
6241 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER*/
6242 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG*/
6243 
6244 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ERROR_TEXT
6245 /*
6246 This returns the description of a numerical error code in English. This is also
6247 the documentation of all the error codes.
6248 */
6249 const char* lodepng_error_text(unsigned code) {
6250  switch (code) {
6251  case 0: return "no error, everything went ok";
6252  case 1: return "nothing done yet"; /*the Encoder/Decoder has done nothing yet, error checking makes no sense yet*/
6253  case 10: return "end of input memory reached without huffman end code"; /*while huffman decoding*/
6254  case 11: return "error in code tree made it jump outside of huffman tree"; /*while huffman decoding*/
6255  case 13: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6256  case 14: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6257  case 15: return "problem while processing dynamic deflate block";
6258  /*this error could happen if there are only 0 or 1 symbols present in the huffman code:*/
6259  case 16: return "invalid code while processing dynamic deflate block";
6260  case 17: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6261  case 18: return "invalid distance code while inflating";
6262  case 19: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6263  case 20: return "invalid deflate block BTYPE encountered while decoding";
6264  case 21: return "NLEN is not ones complement of LEN in a deflate block";
6265 
6266  /*end of out buffer memory reached while inflating:
6267  This can happen if the inflated deflate data is longer than the amount of bytes required to fill up
6268  all the pixels of the image, given the color depth and image dimensions. Something that doesn't
6269  happen in a normal, well encoded, PNG image.*/
6270  case 22: return "end of out buffer memory reached while inflating";
6271  case 23: return "end of in buffer memory reached while inflating";
6272  case 24: return "invalid FCHECK in zlib header";
6273  case 25: return "invalid compression method in zlib header";
6274  case 26: return "FDICT encountered in zlib header while it's not used for PNG";
6275  case 27: return "PNG file is smaller than a PNG header";
6276  /*Checks the magic file header, the first 8 bytes of the PNG file*/
6277  case 28: return "incorrect PNG signature, it's no PNG or corrupted";
6278  case 29: return "first chunk is not the header chunk";
6279  case 30: return "chunk length too large, chunk broken off at end of file";
6280  case 31: return "illegal PNG color type or bpp";
6281  case 32: return "illegal PNG compression method";
6282  case 33: return "illegal PNG filter method";
6283  case 34: return "illegal PNG interlace method";
6284  case 35: return "chunk length of a chunk is too large or the chunk too small";
6285  case 36: return "illegal PNG filter type encountered";
6286  case 37: return "illegal bit depth for this color type given";
6287  case 38: return "the palette is too small or too big"; /*0, or more than 256 colors*/
6288  case 39: return "tRNS chunk before PLTE or has more entries than palette size";
6289  case 40: return "tRNS chunk has wrong size for grayscale image";
6290  case 41: return "tRNS chunk has wrong size for RGB image";
6291  case 42: return "tRNS chunk appeared while it was not allowed for this color type";
6292  case 43: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for palette image";
6293  case 44: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for grayscale image";
6294  case 45: return "bKGD chunk has wrong size for RGB image";
6295  case 48: return "empty input buffer given to decoder. Maybe caused by non-existing file?";
6296  case 49: return "jumped past memory while generating dynamic huffman tree";
6297  case 50: return "jumped past memory while generating dynamic huffman tree";
6298  case 51: return "jumped past memory while inflating huffman block";
6299  case 52: return "jumped past memory while inflating";
6300  case 53: return "size of zlib data too small";
6301  case 54: return "repeat symbol in tree while there was no value symbol yet";
6302  /*jumped past tree while generating huffman tree, this could be when the
6303  tree will have more leaves than symbols after generating it out of the
6304  given lengths. They call this an oversubscribed dynamic bit lengths tree in zlib.*/
6305  case 55: return "jumped past tree while generating huffman tree";
6306  case 56: return "given output image colortype or bitdepth not supported for color conversion";
6307  case 57: return "invalid CRC encountered (checking CRC can be disabled)";
6308  case 58: return "invalid ADLER32 encountered (checking ADLER32 can be disabled)";
6309  case 59: return "requested color conversion not supported";
6310  case 60: return "invalid window size given in the settings of the encoder (must be 0-32768)";
6311  case 61: return "invalid BTYPE given in the settings of the encoder (only 0, 1 and 2 are allowed)";
6312  /*LodePNG leaves the choice of RGB to grayscale conversion formula to the user.*/
6313  case 62: return "conversion from color to grayscale not supported";
6314  /*(2^31-1)*/
6315  case 63: return "length of a chunk too long, max allowed for PNG is 2147483647 bytes per chunk";
6316  /*this would result in the inability of a deflated block to ever contain an end code. It must be at least 1.*/
6317  case 64: return "the length of the END symbol 256 in the Huffman tree is 0";
6318  case 66: return "the length of a text chunk keyword given to the encoder is longer than the maximum of 79 bytes";
6319  case 67: return "the length of a text chunk keyword given to the encoder is smaller than the minimum of 1 byte";
6320  case 68: return "tried to encode a PLTE chunk with a palette that has less than 1 or more than 256 colors";
6321  case 69: return "unknown chunk type with 'critical' flag encountered by the decoder";
6322  case 71: return "invalid interlace mode given to encoder (must be 0 or 1)";
6323  case 72: return "while decoding, invalid compression method encountering in zTXt or iTXt chunk (it must be 0)";
6324  case 73: return "invalid tIME chunk size";
6325  case 74: return "invalid pHYs chunk size";
6326  /*length could be wrong, or data chopped off*/
6327  case 75: return "no null termination char found while decoding text chunk";
6328  case 76: return "iTXt chunk too short to contain required bytes";
6329  case 77: return "integer overflow in buffer size";
6330  case 78: return "failed to open file for reading"; /*file doesn't exist or couldn't be opened for reading*/
6331  case 79: return "failed to open file for writing";
6332  case 80: return "tried creating a tree of 0 symbols";
6333  case 81: return "lazy matching at pos 0 is impossible";
6334  case 82: return "color conversion to palette requested while a color isn't in palette, or index out of bounds";
6335  case 83: return "memory allocation failed";
6336  case 84: return "given image too small to contain all pixels to be encoded";
6337  case 86: return "impossible offset in lz77 encoding (internal bug)";
6338  case 87: return "must provide custom zlib function pointer if LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB is not defined";
6339  case 88: return "invalid filter strategy given for LodePNGEncoderSettings.filter_strategy";
6340  case 89: return "text chunk keyword too short or long: must have size 1-79";
6341  /*the windowsize in the LodePNGCompressSettings. Requiring POT(==> & instead of %) makes encoding 12% faster.*/
6342  case 90: return "windowsize must be a power of two";
6343  case 91: return "invalid decompressed idat size";
6344  case 92: return "integer overflow due to too many pixels";
6345  case 93: return "zero width or height is invalid";
6346  case 94: return "header chunk must have a size of 13 bytes";
6347  case 95: return "integer overflow with combined idat chunk size";
6348  case 96: return "invalid gAMA chunk size";
6349  case 97: return "invalid cHRM chunk size";
6350  case 98: return "invalid sRGB chunk size";
6351  case 99: return "invalid sRGB rendering intent";
6352  case 100: return "invalid ICC profile color type, the PNG specification only allows RGB or GRAY";
6353  case 101: return "PNG specification does not allow RGB ICC profile on gray color types and vice versa";
6354  case 102: return "not allowed to set grayscale ICC profile with colored pixels by PNG specification";
6355  case 103: return "invalid palette index in bKGD chunk. Maybe it came before PLTE chunk?";
6356  case 104: return "invalid bKGD color while encoding (e.g. palette index out of range)";
6357  case 105: return "integer overflow of bitsize";
6358  case 106: return "PNG file must have PLTE chunk if color type is palette";
6359  case 107: return "color convert from palette mode requested without setting the palette data in it";
6360  case 108: return "tried to add more than 256 values to a palette";
6361  }
6362  return "unknown error code";
6363 }
6364 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ERROR_TEXT*/
6365 
6366 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6367 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6368 /* // C++ Wrapper // */
6369 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6370 /* ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// */
6371 
6372 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_CPP
6373 namespace lodepng {
6374 
6375 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6376  unsigned load_file(std::vector<unsigned char>& buffer, const std::string& filename) {
6377  long size = lodepng_filesize(filename.c_str());
6378  if (size < 0) return 78;
6379  buffer.resize((size_t)size);
6380  return size == 0 ? 0 : lodepng_buffer_file(&buffer[0], (size_t)size, filename.c_str());
6381  }
6382 
6383  /*write given buffer to the file, overwriting the file, it doesn't append to it.*/
6384  unsigned save_file(const std::vector<unsigned char>& buffer, const std::string& filename) {
6385  return lodepng_save_file(buffer.empty() ? 0 : &buffer[0], buffer.size(), filename.c_str());
6386  }
6387 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6388 
6389 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB
6390 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
6391  unsigned decompress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
6392  const LodePNGDecompressSettings& settings) {
6393  unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6394  size_t buffersize = 0;
6395  unsigned error = zlib_decompress(&buffer, &buffersize, 0, in, insize, &settings);
6396  if (buffer) {
6397  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6398  lodepng_free(buffer);
6399  }
6400  return error;
6401  }
6402 
6403  unsigned decompress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const std::vector<unsigned char>& in,
6404  const LodePNGDecompressSettings& settings) {
6405  return decompress(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size(), settings);
6406  }
6407 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER */
6408 
6409 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
6410  unsigned compress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, size_t insize,
6411  const LodePNGCompressSettings& settings) {
6412  unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6413  size_t buffersize = 0;
6414  unsigned error = zlib_compress(&buffer, &buffersize, in, insize, &settings);
6415  if (buffer) {
6416  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6417  lodepng_free(buffer);
6418  }
6419  return error;
6420  }
6421 
6422  unsigned compress(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const std::vector<unsigned char>& in,
6423  const LodePNGCompressSettings& settings) {
6424  return compress(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size(), settings);
6425  }
6426 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
6427 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ZLIB */
6428 
6429 
6430 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG
6431 
6432  State::State() {
6433  lodepng_state_init(this);
6434  }
6435 
6436  State::State(const State& other) {
6437  lodepng_state_init(this);
6438  lodepng_state_copy(this, &other);
6439  }
6440 
6441  State::~State() {
6442  lodepng_state_cleanup(this);
6443  }
6444 
6445  State& State::operator=(const State& other) {
6446  lodepng_state_copy(this, &other);
6447  return *this;
6448  }
6449 
6450 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER
6451 
6452  unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h, const unsigned char* in,
6453  size_t insize, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6454  unsigned char* buffer = 0;
6455  unsigned error = lodepng_decode_memory(&buffer, &w, &h, in, insize, colortype, bitdepth);
6456  if (buffer && !error) {
6457  State state;
6458  state.info_raw.colortype = colortype;
6459  state.info_raw.bitdepth = bitdepth;
6460  size_t buffersize = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw);
6461  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6462  }
6463  lodepng_free(buffer);
6464  return error;
6465  }
6466 
6467  unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6468  const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6469  return decode(out, w, h, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], (unsigned)in.size(), colortype, bitdepth);
6470  }
6471 
6472  unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6473  State& state,
6474  const unsigned char* in, size_t insize) {
6475  unsigned char* buffer = NULL;
6476  unsigned error = lodepng_decode(&buffer, &w, &h, &state, in, insize);
6477  if (buffer && !error) {
6478  size_t buffersize = lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw);
6479  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6480  }
6481  lodepng_free(buffer);
6482  return error;
6483  }
6484 
6485  unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h,
6486  State& state,
6487  const std::vector<unsigned char>& in) {
6488  return decode(out, w, h, state, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], in.size());
6489  }
6490 
6491 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6492  unsigned decode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, unsigned& w, unsigned& h, const std::string& filename,
6493  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6494  std::vector<unsigned char> buffer;
6495  /* safe output values in case error happens */
6496  w = h = 0;
6497  unsigned error = load_file(buffer, filename);
6498  if (error) return error;
6499  return decode(out, w, h, buffer, colortype, bitdepth);
6500  }
6501 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DECODER */
6502 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6503 
6504 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER
6505  unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out, const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6506  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6507  unsigned char* buffer;
6508  size_t buffersize;
6509  unsigned error = lodepng_encode_memory(&buffer, &buffersize, in, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6510  if (buffer) {
6511  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6512  lodepng_free(buffer);
6513  }
6514  return error;
6515  }
6516 
6517  unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6518  const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6519  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6520  if (lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, colortype, bitdepth) > in.size()) return 84;
6521  return encode(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6522  }
6523 
6524  unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6525  const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6526  State& state) {
6527  unsigned char* buffer;
6528  size_t buffersize;
6529  unsigned error = lodepng_encode(&buffer, &buffersize, in, w, h, &state);
6530  if (buffer) {
6531  out.insert(out.end(), &buffer[0], &buffer[buffersize]);
6532  lodepng_free(buffer);
6533  }
6534  return error;
6535  }
6536 
6537  unsigned encode(std::vector<unsigned char>& out,
6538  const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6539  State& state) {
6540  if (lodepng_get_raw_size(w, h, &state.info_raw) > in.size()) return 84;
6541  return encode(out, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, state);
6542  }
6543 
6544 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK
6545  unsigned encode(const std::string& filename,
6546  const unsigned char* in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6547  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6548  std::vector<unsigned char> buffer;
6549  unsigned error = encode(buffer, in, w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6550  if (!error) error = save_file(buffer, filename);
6551  return error;
6552  }
6553 
6554  unsigned encode(const std::string& filename,
6555  const std::vector<unsigned char>& in, unsigned w, unsigned h,
6556  LodePNGColorType colortype, unsigned bitdepth) {
6557  if (lodepng_get_raw_size_lct(w, h, colortype, bitdepth) > in.size()) return 84;
6558  return encode(filename, in.empty() ? 0 : &in[0], w, h, colortype, bitdepth);
6559  }
6560 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_DISK */
6561 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ENCODER */
6562 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_PNG */
6563 } /* namespace lodepng */
6564 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_CPP*/
